;;

;;“我; ;希望我;可以10 月 7 日哈马斯残酷袭击以色列南部后的混乱日子里，一名以色列军官向本报记者承认，我们有一个非常详细的计划。超过1,100人被杀；大约 240 人被作为人质拖回加沙。从加沙战争一开始，到现在已经进行了六个月，以色列的两个主要目标——消灭哈马斯和释放人质——就很明显是相互矛盾的。同样显而易见的是，入侵这片领土将是极其困难的，这里有 220 万人口紧密相连，哈马斯在地下修建了迷宫般的加固隧道以帮助其抵御攻击。加沙战争始终存在升级为更大冲突的风险。

;

;可以看到这个毫无希望的起点，得出的结论是，以色列对加沙的入侵进展顺利，许多以色列人也持这种观点。毕竟，哈马斯的战斗力已经大幅削弱，而以色列的伤亡却微乎其微。一些人质已被释放，谈判仍在继续，试图释放其余人质。一直以来，都没有发生地区性大火，西岸（两个巴勒斯坦领土中人口较多的一个）或巴勒斯坦裔以色列人之间甚至没有发生太大的骚乱。

;;

;代价高昂的进展

;

;还有人质疑以色列的安全是否有所改善。哈马斯加沙领导人、10 月 7 日袭击的策划者叶海亚·辛瓦尔 (Yahya Sinwar) 仍然逍遥法外。以色列造成的破坏——约20,000名平民丧生，食品和药品极度短缺，领土上一半以上的建筑被摧毁或损坏——将使战后几乎不可能建立一个稳定、和平的政权。以色列对平民苦难的漠视正在削弱国际社会的同情，并促使盟友质疑他们的支持。怀疑论者问道，以色列会赢得这场战斗但却输掉战争吗？

;;
;

;;;阅读我们对以色列与哈马斯之间战争的所有报道;;

;
;

;认为战争已经成功的观点始于对哈马斯造成的损害。以色列官员声称，他们已经杀死了 13,000 名哈马斯战士，大约是该组织战前人数的一半。一些外国间谍暗示死亡人数较低，可能是三分之一。哈马斯自己在 2 月中旬承认至少有 6,000 人伤亡。虽然很难知道哪个数字是准确的，但损失是真实的。哈马斯的大部分旅都遭到重创。它也失去了指挥官。本周有消息称，其军事部门副领导人马尔万·伊萨 (Marwan Issa) 在 3 月初对加沙的空袭中身亡。军事部门的另一位高级领导人萨利赫·阿鲁里 (Saleh al-Arouri) 一月份在贝鲁特被暗杀。与此同时，以色列在地面入侵中损失了大约 250 名士兵，这是 20 世纪 80 年代以来所有战争中损失最多的一次，但远低于许多人对激烈的城市战的担忧。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;哈马斯估计的 20,000 枚火箭弹已耗尽。它已经发射了 60% 的炸弹，但收效甚微，还有数千枚被摧毁。其隧道网络已严重受损，特别是在加沙北部。由于缺乏人员和物资，它可能不会对以色列构成严重威胁，甚至在几年内也不会再次统治加沙——如果真的有的话。民意调查显示，该组织在当地的受欢迎程度急剧下降，大概是因为许多加沙人指责哈马斯将他们拖入一场无法获胜的地狱战争。只有 38% 的人希望看到哈马斯在战后继续掌权。

;

;与此同时，以色列已设法释放近一半的人质没有向哈马斯做出任何重大让步。这对于大约 130 名仍然下落不明的家庭来说并不能带来安慰（军方估计，其中可能有四分之一已经死亡）。但这是一个比 10 月 7 日之后许多人预期的结果更好的结果。更重要的是，以色列所做的这一切都没有引发其他巴勒斯坦人的严重暴力，无论是在约旦河西岸还是在以色列境内。它还在北部边境保持了平衡。黎巴嫩什叶派激进组织真主党几乎每天都对以色列发动导弹袭击，但它尚未开辟完整的第二条战线。

;

;在国内，公众搁置了一年的政治尖刻，团结在旗帜周围。预备役军人按要求报到，去年公众抗议有争议的司法改革最激烈时，一些人曾威胁不这样做，但后来被搁置。袭击发生后组建的跨党派战时内阁已经团结了五个月，尽管其成员之间存在深深的敌意。经济遭受了可预见的收缩，但谢克尔已经弥补了最初的损失。到 2025 年，公共债务占 GDP 的比例将从去年的 60% 上升至预计的 67%，但这仍然是可控的，而且央行拥有 2070 亿美元的外汇储备作为健康缓冲。

;

;许多外国人对战争造成的平民伤亡表示愤怒，但以色列人认为这很正常。此外，愤怒还没有转化为行动。大多数西方亲密盟友，包括美国、英国和德国，甚至没有呼吁永久停火，更不用说对以色列采取任何形式的惩罚行动了。尽管民众对以色列的战争行为感到愤怒，但就连与以色列有外交关系的六个阿拉伯国家除了召回大使外也没有采取太多行动。以色列人仍然可以搭乘每日从特拉维夫飞往迪拜的航班。

;;
;;
;

;但是这些都没有考虑更长期的情况。从安全开始。在不对称战争中，伤亡人数并不是衡量成功与否的一个糟糕标准。美国在越南吸取了这个教训，然后又在阿富汗和伊拉克吸取了教训。武装组织未来在加沙废墟中招募新兵似乎不太可能遇到困难。

;

;当战争结束时，加沙将不再适宜居住。数十万人将无家可归。纽约城市大学和俄勒冈州立大学的研究人员估计，加沙至少 55% 的建筑物遭受了结构性损坏（见地图）。经济已被摧毁：工厂遭到轰炸；小企业被消灭；农作物和牲畜被毁。坦克炸毁了道路，空袭摧毁了电网和供水网络。 ;联合国;估计加沙 76% 的学校已被损坏或摧毁。它的医院状况同样严峻。

;

;逃跑风险

;

;受过教育的人会尝试在国外开始新的生活。卑微的移民也会试图逃离，乘船前往欧洲碰碰运气。然而，大多数加沙人别无选择，只能忍受。他们将在拥挤的避难所和帐篷城市里徘徊数月，甚至数年，几乎没有工作机会，只能靠援助维持生计。这片飞地的居民大部分是来自现在的以色列的难民后裔，将成为一个巨大的流离失所者营地。

;

;如果哈马斯试图在战斗结束时从隧道中出来并重申其令状，鉴于其实力减弱和受欢迎程度下降，它很可能会失败，更不用说与以色列发生进一步冲突的可能性了。相反，它可能会回到游击队时代，对以色列军队和被视为合作者的巴勒斯坦人进行攻击。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;但是巴勒斯坦权力机构 (;管理西岸部分地区的温和派巴勒斯坦权力机构（PA）也将努力介入并夺取权力。它几乎无法控制其目前管理的领土，并且自 2007 年哈马斯驱逐它以来，它就一直缺席加沙。年迈的总统马哈茂德·阿巴斯 (Mahmoud Abbas) 正忙着在自己的小国内遏制对哈马斯的支持：62% 的约旦河西岸居民表示，武装分子应该代表巴勒斯坦事业（而加沙人的这一比例仅为 43%）。整整88%的巴勒斯坦人希望阿巴斯先生辞职，而他缺乏明确的继任者。 3月14日，他任命经济学家穆罕默德·穆斯塔法为总理。他希望这能够向持怀疑态度的西方捐助者表明，他对于改革臭名昭著的腐败的<小>;巴勒斯坦权力机构;是认真的。但对许多人来说，这种平淡无奇的姿态只是证实了;巴勒斯坦权力机构;已经变得多么无能和无能。

;

;美国及其阿拉伯国家盟国希望重新启动数千名无所事事的加沙警察，他们在哈马斯接管之前为<小>;巴勒斯坦权力机构;工作，此后就得到报酬坐在家里。但以色列政府的右翼分子不喜欢这个想法，而且无论如何，它不太可能奏效。 2007 年，加沙警察未能阻止哈马斯控制该飞地，而且在 17 年后，加沙警察的效力可能也没有提高。权力可能会移交给强大的家族，他们已经在试图控制援助的流动。加沙最终可能不会出现一个正常运转的政府，而是出现军阀。但无论残骸中出现什么，都不可能让以色列人感到安全。

;

;几十年来，以色列的安全理论一直依赖于三大支柱：威慑、预警、决定性胜利。如果前两次失败（偶尔会失败），以色列就会通过短暂而激烈的战争来恢复威慑力。这些冲突对国内的影响有限。 2014年针对哈马斯的上一场战争是迄今为止持续时间最长的一场战争，以色列平民死亡人数仅为六人；对于巴勒斯坦人来说，这一数字约为 1,500。

;

;所有三大支柱现已崩溃。哈马斯并没有被阻止进行大胆的袭击。以色列自诩的情报部门失败了。一系列旨在监控加沙边境的高科技设备也是如此。接下来的战争既不短暂也不具有决定性。十月，以色列需要美国的支持，美国向该地区派遣了两个航空母舰群，以阻止真主党和其他武装组织开辟第二条战线。虽然真主党尚未对以色列发动全面攻击，但其行动已足以使北部城镇的 8 万以色列人流离失所。当加沙的战斗结束时，他们将不得不决定是否返回北部，因为他们知道装备比哈马斯强大得多的对手就潜伏在边境另一边。

;

;无党派智库以色列民主研究所每月都会询问以色列人是否对“国家安全的未来”持乐观态度。 10 月下旬，其首次战时调查发现 46% 的以色列犹太人充满希望。到 3 月份，这一数字已降至 41%。半年的战争让以色列人感到更不安全，而不是更安全。一名军官表示：“整个以色列的自信心发生了巨大变化，再也不会像以前那样了。”

;
;< div>;
;
;
;
;

;部分问题是国内政治。四分之三的以色列人希望内塔尼亚胡先生辞职（他们对于他应该现在辞职还是战后辞职存在分歧）。公众认为他对 10 月 7 日事件负有责任——不仅因为他错过了警告信号，而且还因为他多年来加强哈马斯以破坏<小>;巴勒斯坦权力机构;的政策。他拒绝谈论辞职或责任。他的媒体先锋（批评者称之为“毒药机器”）花了几个月的时间试图将责任转移到别处。内塔尼亚胡先生本人甚至在一条后来被删除的推文中对军队进行了战时攻击。

;

;内塔尼亚胡先生通过迎合他的观点来加深分歧极右翼联盟伙伴，大概是希望避免提前选举。以本月早些时候议会批准的他的战时预算为例。它对文职部门进行了大幅削减，但为宗教权利保留了一些好处。其中 17 亿谢克尔（4.67 亿美元）用于极端正统派学校，这些学校经常忽视国家课程，另外 2 亿谢克尔用于由极右翼定居者领导的就业部。与此同时，来自南北的以色列流离失所者抱怨政府除了支付酒店账单外几乎没有提供任何帮助。

;

;完全混乱

;

;甚至战争本身也变得分裂。以色列人对于是继续战斗以追求内塔尼亚胡承诺的“全面胜利”还是停止战斗以促成人质交易存在分歧。只有 42% 的以色列人希望继续前进，而 47% 的人准备停止（见图 1）。在极右翼内阁成员伊塔马尔·本-格维尔（Itamar Ben-Gvir）的监督下，警察向抗议政府的人质家属喷射高压水枪，同时小心翼翼地对付试图阻止向加沙运送援助的极右翼活动分子。 .

;
;;
;

;;Benny Gantz;，前军队成员十月份加入联合政府的酋长是最有可能在选举中接替内塔尼亚胡先生的人选，尽管他尚未想出如何设计选举。如果他成为总理，他将花大量时间处理战争的后果。更长的征兵期限和更重的预备役军人负担将拖累经济。更高的国防开支和重建边境附近遭受重创的城镇的成本将需要削减其他领域，或提高税收，或两者兼而有之。他的选民将会分裂并受到创伤，而且最重要的是，他将不得不应对全球爆发的愤怒。

;

;之前战争结束后，阿拉伯世界正逐渐走向与以色列的关系正常化。不再。自十月以来，加沙的创伤一直是阿拉伯电视屏幕和智能手机上的焦点——不仅有死亡和绝望的场景，还有以色列针对巴勒斯坦人的无休无止的非人性言论。沙特阿拉伯当局花了数年时间试图让本国民众做好与以色列关系正常化的准备，但亲以色列智库华盛顿研究所去年12月发布的一项调查发现，96%的沙特人认为阿拉伯国家应该与以色列断绝一切关系。以色列。

;
;;
;

;亚伯拉罕协议（2020 年签署的协议，四个阿拉伯国家承认以色列）的支持者表示，该协议仍然可以扩大。这将要求阿拉伯领导人无视几乎普遍的反对意见。也许他们会（他们都是独裁者），但这并不是一项条约的坚实基础，无论如何，该条约已经失去了大部分战略依据。这些协议不仅仅是允许以色列人在迪拜度假。它们还旨在巩固针对伊朗的区域联盟，并促进以“由外而内”的方式解决以色列-巴勒斯坦冲突：随着阿拉伯国家与以色列建立关系，它们也会迫使巴勒斯坦人签署和平协议。现在看来这两个目标都遥不可及。海湾国家已不再与伊朗对抗，以免导致本国遭受袭击。以色列右翼将 10 月 7 日的暴行作为拒绝两国解决方案的进一步理由（几十年来以色列一直在抵制这一解决方案），让巴勒斯坦人改变立场似乎并不是主要障碍。

;
;;
;

;这不仅仅是阿拉伯人的观点这种情况已经发生了变化。即使在战前，西方的年轻人也不像他们的长辈那样亲以色列。民意调查机构皮尤研究中心 2022 年的一项调查发现，18 至 29 岁的美国人中只有 41% 对以色列持好感，而 65 岁以上的人中这一比例为 69%。战争扩大了这一鸿沟。 YouGov 2 月份的一项民意调查发现，65 岁以上的美国人中有 20% 认为以色列是一个种族隔离国家，而 18 岁至 29 岁的美国人中有 39% 认为以色列是一个种族隔离国家（见图 2）。上个月，当盖洛普询问美国人是否更同情以色列人还是巴勒斯坦人时，老年人以 40% 的优势选择了以色列，而年轻人则以 45% 比 37% 的比例选择了巴勒斯坦人。大西洋两岸的结果相似：52% 的英国年轻人认为以色列的战争不公正，而 65 岁以上的人中这一比例为 36%。

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;以色列人倾向于忽视这一点。他们认为，大学校园和左翼犹太教堂可能存在一些焦虑，但这并没有动摇西方官员。然而，除非今天的学生变得更加鹰派，否则以色列未来的支持看起来并不稳固。甚至当今的一些政客也出人意料地摇摆不定。纽约的;查克·舒默;也许是参议院中最亲以色列的民主党人。他是 2015 年投票反对伊朗核协议的仅有的四名民主党参议员之一，他站在内塔尼亚胡一边，而不是巴拉克·奥巴马(Barack Obama)。不过，3 月 14 日，他在参议院猛烈抨击内塔尼亚胡先生，称总理“迷失了方向”，并呼吁提前举行选举来取代他。

;

;舒默先生并没有放弃以色列。目前，他的愤怒与其他一些民主党人一样，针对的是内塔尼亚胡：他们想要一位新的以色列领导人，而不是联盟破裂。以色列的乐观主义者希望政府的更迭能让他们重新赢得美国的青睐。也许会——但只是暂时的。甘茨领导的联盟可能会包括反对两国解决方案的右翼政党；它不太可能对减少定居点、重振和平进程或推进其他美国利益起多大作用。而且最早也不太可能在秋季之前上台。

;

;内塔尼亚胡先生执政的时间越长，不可思议的事情开始发生的时间就越长在美国政治中变得合理。停止对以色列的军事援助或对其施加条件，过去只是政治边缘人士表达的想法。现在它们已成为主流。就连中间派民主党参议员、拜登的密友克里斯·库恩斯(Chris Coons)等人也公开讨论过此类想法。一场摊牌可能即将到来。拜登表示，以色列对加沙唯一没有被占领的城市拉法的入侵将是一条“红线”，因为可能会造成更多平民伤亡。内塔尼亚胡先生断然表示，以色列军队将在某个时候进入拉法。

;

;拜登先生可能会做出让步。到目前为止，他还没有表现出与以色列对抗的兴趣。如果唐纳德·特朗普接替他成为总统，发生冲突的可能性就会更小。他攻击拜登和其他民主党人对以色列的支持不够（以及所有投票支持民主党的犹太人憎恨以色列及其宗教）。尽管如此，对以色列的军事援助现在已经成为公开辩论的话题，这一点已经越过了卢比孔河。以总统二月份向国务院发出的指示为例，要求国务院报告外国政府是否使用美国武器犯下暴行。目前这还只是一个简单的做法，但未来的政治家可能不会这样使用它。美国还对约旦河西岸暴力的以色列定居者实施制裁；这些可能会扩大到诱捕像本-格维尔先生这样的政客。出于同样的原因，联邦法律禁止向犯有战争罪的国家提供军事援助。如果国务院牵涉以色列，美国将不得不减少其支持。

;
;;
;

;国际法院正在审理南非提出申诉，指控以色列在加沙实施种族灭绝。即使驳回，国际刑事法院（审理针对个人而非国家的申诉）也可能受理其他案件。它于 2019 年开始调查以色列和被占领土上可能发生的战争罪行。比利时承诺提供 500 万欧元（540 万美元）来​​调查当前战争中的潜在罪行。法院想必希望这些努力能得到一些成果。南非外交部长本月早些时候表示，在加沙与以色列军队作战的公民回国后将被逮捕。自由派以色列人长期以来一直警告说，未来他们的政客和将军将不再能自由出国旅行，以免被拖到海牙。那一天可能还没有到来，但比六个月前更近了。

;

;战争也使旧有的政治裂痕重新浮现。在 20 世纪 90 年代和 2000 年代初，与巴勒斯坦人的冲突对以色列选民来说是一个影响深远的问题。然后和平阵营崩溃了，这个话题也逐渐淡出人们的视野。过去15年里，以色列的选举是对内塔尼亚胡继续统治的全民公投。 2015年主要反对党的竞选口号是“要么我们，要么他”。下一次选举可能是最后一次此类公投。内塔尼亚胡先生的声望已经消失，他因腐败而接受审判，战后他将面临一个调查委员会，对 10 月 7 日和战争进行调查。很难想象即使这样的幸存者还能赢得连任。

;

;然而，内塔尼亚胡先生的退出，即使真的到来，也不会结束政治不和。温和的以色列人渴望一位能够将他们的政治拉回到中间的领导人。他们希望有人边缘化极右翼分子，结束对极端正统犹太人的征兵豁免，并加强民主规范。但笨手笨脚的甘茨先生似乎不太可能是候选人。巴勒斯坦人将重新回到议程上，右翼往往会利用这个话题来煽动选民的恐惧，并取得巨大的政治成功。

;

;批评者列出了一长串以色列自 10 月 7 日以来本可以采取不同行动的事情。它本可以向加沙提供更多的人道主义援助，并用种族清洗的言论来谴责沙文主义政客。它本可以等待报复，然后选择有限的特种部队袭击，而不是大规模的空中轰炸。它本来可以开放地与美国和阿拉伯国家讨论战后安排。其中一些投诉是有效的。加沙的饥饿对以色列来说既是道德上的失败，也是战略上的责任。其他人则充满幻想。很少有军队会在将部队投入城市战之前避开来自上方的闪电战。

;

;然而，战争的最大问题不是其行为，而是其可能的结果是：这将使以色列更加深陷占领的泥潭，几十年来，占领已经扭曲了其社会并毒害了其外交关系。当然，造成这种悲惨局面的罪魁祸首不仅仅是以色列。尽管自 1948 年以来这只给巴勒斯坦人带来了痛苦，但拒绝主义倾向在巴勒斯坦人中根深蒂固。当战斗停止时，以色列和哈马斯都可能会宣布胜利。事实上，没有人是赢家。 ;■;

;;B;;ASF is in; the business of molecules. As the world's biggest chemicals firm, with operations in more than 90 countries, it makes a lot of them. When those molecules contain carbon atoms (and a great many do—they are a wonderfully versatile resource) those carbon atoms tend to come from fossil fuels. When their manufacture requires high temperatures, which is also often the case, that heat comes from burning fossil fuels. Until recently ;BASF;'s massive plant in Ludwigshafen in Germany accounted for 4% of the country's entire consumption of natural gas.

;

;Conventional wisdom has it that such a firm cannot really hope to lower very much the number of carbon-dioxide molecules it creates in the course of its business. The path to decarbonisation will come instead from gathering up those molecules and disposing of them underground, a process known as carbon capture and storage (;CCS;). The same conventional wisdom holds that if ;BASF; were to swear off burning molecules of gas to create heat, the obvious green alternative would be to burn hydrogen molecules instead. Those molecules would have to be manufactured, too, in an energy-intensive process.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;That is why the recent declaration by Martin Brudermüller, the boss of ;BASF;, that “the decarbonisation of energy-intensive industries can only be achieved through electrification” sounds, to many ears, like heresy. Electricity is for houses and light bulbs and maybe even for cars, but not for heavy industries built around burning heroic quantities of fossil fuel. Yet Dr Brudermüller is not alone.

;

;;BASF; has joined a consortium including ;SABIC;, a Saudi chemicals firm, and Linde, a European engineering firm, to develop an electric furnace that can generate heat intense enough for the chemical reactions that are their bread and butter. These firms are not the only recent converts to the electrification of industry. On February 8th Rio Tinto and ;BHP;, both gargantuan mining firms, announced a joint effort to build Australia's first electric smelter for iron ore. Fortescue, another mining giant, is introducing all-electric excavators and mining lorries, while Spain's Roca Group recently unveiled the first electric industrial tunnel kiln for ceramics. Such innovations offer a new path to slowing global warming which may in many cases prove quicker and easier than approaches based on ;CCS; and hydrogen.

;;

;Industrial fail

;

;According to the International Energy Agency (;IEA;), a research body, industry consumes a third of all global energy, with the generation of heat accounting for three-quarters of that. A staggering 90% of that heat is made by burning fossil fuels. All this makes industry a bigger source of greenhouse-gas emissions than power generation or transport. What is more, whereas carbon-dioxide emissions from power generation appear to have peaked and, if electric vehicles continue to proliferate, emissions from transport may soon stop growing, too, industrial emissions are projected to keep growing indefinitely (see chart 1).

; ; ;
; ; ;;;
;

;Aware that this is impossible to square with their commitments to slash emissions, governments in advanced economies have showered subsidies on hydrogen and ;CCS; as the technologies most likely to help decarbonise industry. Both, however, have so far disappointed. Electrification, meanwhile, had long been dismissed for two reasons. First, it was argued, the very high temperatures and steam required by heavy industry would be difficult or at least uneconomic to produce with electricity. Second, the standard ways of making cement and steel require carbon as an input, which means emitting carbon dioxide is unavoidable even if clean electricity were to replace the burning of fossil fuels.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Yet McKinsey, a consultancy, predicts that 44% of the decarbonisation it foresees in Europe by 2050, should the ;EU ;stick to its net-zero targets, will come from electrification, more than double the share of hydrogen and; CCS ;combined. Why is it so optimistic about an unheralded technology?

;

;Electrification is suddenly getting a second look for several reasons, argues Jeffrey Rissman in a new book: “Zero-Carbon Industry”. Most obviously, green electricity has become much cheaper and more widely available thanks to the remarkable decline in the cost of wind and solar power. Another factor is growing wariness of reliance on natural gas, thanks to the global price shock that followed Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Supplies of gas ran so low in Germany, for example, that the government considered rationing it for industrial users like ;BASF;.

;

;But the best reason for reconsideration is innovation. Making things hot with electricity is not that hard; think of an electric kettle. Such technologies can scale: if you want ten times as much boiling water, get ten kettles or one bigger one. But if you want to get to 1,000°C instead of 100°C, until recently there were few electric options. That is now changing.

;

;Electric avenue

;

;For temperatures of up to 200°C, the technology attracting most attention is not the electric kettle but the industrial heat pump. Heat pumps, like refrigerators, move heat from one place to another. In a fridge the heat is removed from the inside (keeping the contents cooler) and dumped outside (making the kitchen a little warmer). Heat pumps, which are becoming increasingly common for domestic heating, take heat from outside and move it inside. Because the amount of energy needed to move heat this way is lower than the amount needed to heat things up directly, this can lead to big energy savings. And as the technology improves and sales increase, prices are falling.

;

;Some companies are betting that what works in the home can work in the factory ， 也。 One such is AtmosZero, a startup that aims to reduce emissions at New Belgium Brewing, an American beermaker. AtmosZero is installing a heat pump that will soon replace one of the gas-fired boilers at New Belgium's brewery in Fort Collins, Colorado. Like most industrial firms over the past 150 years, New Belgium burns fossil fuel to produce steam, which in its case then heats the ingredients required to make beer. AtmosZero's heat pump will allow it to produce that steam without any burning. Since the electricity used to run the pump will be renewable in the future, that eliminates most greenhouse-gas emissions from the process. It is also more efficient, consuming less energy overall. And because the heat pump transfers warmth to water, just as in a conventional boiler, the equipment can be slotted into New Belgium's existing factory, without the need for a complete overhaul.

;
;;
;

;Such heat pumps would allow a vast array of industrial processes that require heat of less than 200°C to be electrified, replacing fossil-fuelled dryers, stills, ovens and boilers.使用电力运行热泵的效率比使用天然气加热锅炉的效率高几倍。 Using hydrogen, in contrast, is less efficient, because making hydrogen by splitting water molecules through hydrolysis powered by green electricity, although emission-free, involves a loss of at least 20% of the energy you started with (see chart 2).

;

;Some industrial heat pumps are in use in Europe and Japan, thanks both to subsidies and to a relatively high ratio of gas prices to electricity prices.日本大型工业公司神户制钢所销售的商用热泵能够非常有效地产生 165°C 的高压蒸汽。 Heaten 是一家挪威初创公司，拥有英国石油巨头壳牌风险投资部门的投资，该公司开发了一种耐用、低维护的热泵，可以利用工业废热将温度提高到 200°C。 That makes it attractive for industries from pharmaceuticals to textiles that need middling heat.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Even in developing countries in Asia, electrification of relatively low-heat industries is making headway, despite the region's abundance of cheap coal and lack of subsidies, which makes it harder for heat pumps and the like to compete. ;RMI;, a think-tank, calculates that some four-fifths of the increase in industrial electrification globally since 2014 has taken place in Chinese light industries. The ;IEA; predicts that the share of heat used in industry that is generated with electricity will rise from 4% in 2022 to almost 11% in 2028. China will account for almost half of that growth, boosting its use of renewable electricity to generate industrial heat more than five-fold.

;

;In America, electrified solutions are making inroads even though natural gas is comparatively cheap 。 A study published in January by the Renewable Thermal Collaborative (;RTC;), an industry consortium, finds it costs no more to run a heat pump than a gas boiler when trying to attain temperatures below 130°C.这将使热泵在无需任何补贴或技术改进的情况下，能够满足 29% 的工业用热需求。 The ;RTC; expects heat pumps for temperatures of up to 200°C to become competitive by 2030. Harald Bauer of McKinsey expects that, in time, heat pumps will be able to reach temperatures of 500°C.

;

;For the time being, however, higher temperatures require different technology. “您在这里看到的是工业能源基础设施的未来！”开发“热存储”的初创公司 Rondo Energy 的负责人约翰·奥唐纳 (John O'Donnell) 宣称。 At first glance, the future does not seem that remarkable: the object of his enthusiasm is a big metal box.

;

;It mainly contains bricks.电线利用电力将砖块加热到 1,000°C 以上的温度，就像烤面包机加热面包一样。在极其有效的隔热作用下，这些砖可以保留热量数天，而损失却很小。当需要时，可以在不同的温度下以受控剂量释放热量。 Air is blown through channels in the bricks, transferring heat.

;

;Rondo's thermal batteries are cheaper to manufacture than electric ones that require cobalt or lithium.储存的热量足以为许多重工业提供动力。与 AtmosZero 的热泵一样，它们可以安装到现有工厂中，而无需完全重新设计。 And since each battery is so efficient, it can consume electricity to heat the bricks when power is cheapest but dispense heat any time.

;

;The box is generating lots of enthusiasm. Rondo 最近从软件巨头微软、沙特国家石油公司沙特国家石油公司和力拓等企业巨头的风险投资部门筹集了 6000 万美元的资金。它的支持者中有众多科技投资界的杰出人物。 After a widely viewed ;TED; talk and a recent lecture to the great and the good at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, Mr O'Donnell chuckles, he is known as “the brick guy”.

;

;Mr O'Donnell is planning a big global expansion. With the help of Thailand's Siam Cement Group, an investor with plenty of experience making bricks, Rondo hopes to manufacture enough boxes each year to store 90;GW;h of electricity—double the capacity of Tesla's “gigafactory” for batteries in Nevada.

;

;Other companies are developing variations of these “rocks in a box”.布伦米勒是一家由欧洲投资银行部分资助的以色列公司，使用火山岩作为存储介质。 Antora 是一家加州初创公司，它使用大块固体碳来储存高达 1,800°C 的热量。波士顿的 Fourth Power 使用流经石墨砖系统（和石墨管道）的熔融锡来提供 2,400°C 的存储温度。由于锡发出白热光，系统内部的专用光伏电池意味着能量可以以电能和热能的形式提取。在电价波动的地区，只需在电价便宜时储存热量，在电价上涨时分配电力即可盈利。

;

;The hardest industrial processes to electrify are those that require intense heat around the clock, especially if they use fossil fuels not only to generate heat but also to provide some sort of chemical necessity—such as the carbon used in steelmaking. This is the most experimental end of the spectrum of electrifying industry, but also potentially the most rewarding, since steel, chemicals and cement together account for more than half of industrial heat and thus for a similar proportion of industrial emissions of greenhouse gases.

;

;Several well-funded startups are pursuing radical innovations in aspects of steelmaking, one of the world's most polluting industries. Electra, which is backed by Amazon and ;BHP; among others, has found a way to make pure iron in a fire-free furnace.阿诺德·施瓦辛格饰演的终结者在钢铁厂中遭遇熔化的结局，其科罗拉多实验室的研究人员将铁矿石溶解在化学混合物中，并用电流将其击碎，照片中的终结者怒视着他们。这种“电解冶金”技术生产纯铁片，不使用任何炼焦煤或化石燃料，因此几乎不排放任何温室气体。 The firm is chasing rivals including ;SSAB;, from Sweden, which plans to commercialise green steel by 2026.

;
;;
;

;A more tried and tested method of reducing the carbon emissions from steelmaking replaces blast furnaces with electric-arc furnaces.这些通常使用电力来熔化和回收废金属，而不是使用铁矿石和焦煤从头开始炼钢。这对于那些碳价较高、废钢充足且钢铁需求相对稳定的国家（换句话说，就是富裕国家）来说是最有意义的。一月份，塔塔钢铁公司宣布将关闭英国的高炉并转向电气化炼钢。研究公司 Wood Mackenzie 预计未来几年电弧炉投资将达到 1300 亿美元。 That would allow low-emission steel production, currently 28% of global output, to rise to 50% by 2050.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Cement is another tricky industry to decarbonise because, like steelmaking, its emissions come from the chemical reactions involved, as well as from burning fossil fuels to generate heat. Sublime Systems 找到了一种在室温下获得必要化学物质且不会排放的方法，即利用电解——一种通过溶液中的电流来激发化学反应的过程。 “我们基本上正在更换窑炉，”该公司的联合创始人 Leah Ellis 解释道。 Investors including Siam Cement poured in $40m last year.

;

;The third giant, sooty industry is chemicals.电气化的一种根本形式是将化学前体送入超高速转子，该转子每分钟旋转超过 20,000 转。芬兰公司 Coolbrook 是这种“旋转动力反应堆”的先驱。 It is backed by Braskem, a Brazilian firm, Cemex, a Mexican one and ;SABIC,; a Saudi one.去年 12 月，该公司宣布已使用该技术来裂解（分解）石脑油，这是该行业的常见工艺。

;

;Some chemicals firms are also looking at nuclear power as a source of electricity and heat. Dow, an American one, plans to build four small modular reactors made by ;X;-energy, a startup, at a plant in Texas. These will replace gas-fired boilers that currently provide electricity and steam.

;

;Amping up

;

;Even if such technologies work as advertised, electrifying industry will take time.法国大型工业设备制造商施耐德电气 (Schneider Electric) 的弗雷德里克·戈德梅尔 (Frederic Godemel) 认为，现有技术理论上可以使 30% 至 50% 的重工业实现电气化。但实际上，他认为现在只有 10% 是电气化的。 That is because, even when new electrical kit is competitive over the long run with existing equipment, factory bosses often resist switching because it involves high upfront costs, disruptive stoppages, training on the new gear and so on.

;

;Carbon pricing or other incentives to cut emissions would obviously help.最大限度地减少干扰的技术也是如此。 AtmosZero 首席执行官艾迪生·斯塔克 (Addison Stark) 解释说，他的公司明确地着手克服管理者的反对意见，将其电锅炉设计成能够轻松插入现有工厂，从而减少安装的麻烦。 “Steam powered the first Industrial Revolution,” he declares, “and decarbonised steam will power the next one.”

;

;One indication that electrification may live up to its promise is the interest shown by oil and gas companies, whose products the technology is intended to supplant.挪威国有石油公司 Equinor 长期以来一直在对其海上钻井平台进行电气化，以减少石油开采过程中的排放。其最高效的海上作业每生产一桶石油（或等量的天然气）排放的二氧化碳不到 1 公斤，而全球平均排放量为每桶 15 公斤。在美国二叠纪盆地钻探的石油公司迫于监管机构削减排放的压力，正花费数十亿美元用电力替代品来取代容易泄漏甲烷（一种强效温室气体）的传统设备。如果连电气化的天敌都能看到它的价值，那么它的前景一定是光明的。 ;■;

;
;

;Across China hundreds of thousands of the well-to-do have suffered landmine injuries in recent months.中植是一家去年 12 月破产的投资公司，欠其 15 万客户 360 亿美元。爆炸式增长并不仅限于财富管理公司。到目前为止，中国最常见的投资是房地产，而房地产价值近三年来一直在下降。股市也在下滑：最著名的指数之一上证综合指数自 2021 年的峰值以来已下跌了 20% 以上。尽管政府过去曾介入帮助遭受资产价格暴跌打击的投资者，但这次它几乎没有表现出救助的倾向。 Ms Xue will have to try to stanch the bleeding on her own.

;

;China publishes almost no official data about the distribution of wealth, perhaps for fear of revealing just how unequal it is. But ;The Economist; has analysed nationwide surveys from 2018 and 2020 that asked participants about their income and investments, weighting the responses to reflect China's demography. That has yielded a rough breakdown of who owns most of the financial assets that are losing value so fast, and so allowed us to infer what the swooning markets might mean for China's economy and society.

;;

;Year of the drubbing

;

;A huge share of the country's wealth, it turns out, is in the hands of people like Ms Xue.市场给他们带来的沉重打击，以及政府明显的漠不关心，正在重塑他们的投资偏好，这种情况很可能会在未来几年内发生。这反过来将阻碍当局发展金融体系的计划，从而减缓中国未来的增长。 Ms Xue and investors like her will suffer the most, but China's economy will also end up scarred by the detonations.

;;
;;
;

;The survey data suggest that about 50% of China's wealth is in the hands of the 113m or so people with a net worth of 1m-10m yuan.这个群体（仅占总人口的 8%）对金融市场的影响力甚至比他们的财富所显示的还要大。 They own 64% of all publicly traded shares, for instance, and 61% of investment funds (see chart 1).

;

;The group are the main beneficiaries of China's 40-odd years of booming growth.他们出生于 20 世纪 60 年代、70 年代和 80 年代初，是文化大革命期间学校停课后第一批重返大学的人。他们是第一批创办小型私营企业的群体。 1990年上海证券交易所开业时，他们是第一批入场的散户投资者。自1986年一家国有银行发放第一笔抵押贷款以来，它们还推动了中国的房地产市场。许多人从20世纪90年代的住房私有化中获利，以微薄的价格购买了如今价值不菲的公寓。他们在工作生活中经历了生活水平的奇迹般的转变，从公用厨房到度假屋。 Deng Xiaoping declared in the late 1970s that China would reject Maoism and “let some people get rich first”, and these are the people who did.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Ms Xue appears to be a typical member of the “got-rich-first” group.她是一位 40 多岁的北京人，在从事广告工作 25 年后，打算提前退休。她进行了大量储蓄和投资。除了引爆的理财产品外，她还拥有一套住宅投资物业和部分出租的商业物业。她大约 20% 的积蓄都投入了股票市场。所有这些投资现在都在贬值。转向哪里并不明显。中国严格的资本管制使得资金转移到国外变得困难且昂贵；她最接近的是一份来自澳门的保险单，澳门是一个具有不同金融法规和自己​​货币的“特别行政区”。 Ms Xue's only other form of diversification has been to stash away some gold.

;

;For China's wealthy, the present market turmoil is unprecedented and disorienting.几十年来，房地产价格一直稳步上涨，2008 年只出现了小幅波动。尽管股市波动较大，但国家通常会进行干预，以防止股市大跌。当出现问题时，更深奥的理财产品的投资者也能从救助中受益，同时获得高收益。 A recent survey of affluent Chinese by Charles Schwab, an American asset manager, found that more than half expected 20-40% annual returns.

;

;Dragon mire

;

;Such expectations are looking ever less plausible.在习近平担任中国领导人的第一个任期内，即2013-18年，个人投资收入年均增长10.8%。在习近平第二任期内，这一数字下降至 7%。 Over the past two years it has sunk below 5%.

;

;In part, this reflects Mr Xi's determination to prevent bubbles and thus make the financial system more stable.为此，他试图消除人们认为国家将救助任何陷入困境的金融公司的假设。例如，2018年，他发起了对网络借贷平台的打击，消灭了一个未偿还贷款1万亿人民币的行业。 That was part of a broader campaign to restrict lending outside banks, which has shrunk by more than half since 2016.

;

;The authorities still seem keen to shield the poor from turmoil in the financial system.例如，今年中央政府将尝试合并2000多家资产超过6万亿美元的村镇银行，以加强主要为中国经济阶梯最底层人群服务的机构。但富人的情况就不同了。 2022年几家小银行倒闭时，超过50万元的存款国家没有偿还。出于同样的原因，随着房地产开发商破产，国家在拯救那些为从未建成的公寓付费的人方面一直拖延，其中许多人相对富裕。 Wealthier investors, the logic runs, can afford to absorb the losses and should understand the risks.

;

;But the risks are often opaque, and different investments more closely related than they at first appear.在中国社交媒体上搜索“地雷投资”，就会发现无数关于信托和其他理财产品的帖子。这些通常将现金从中国的富人那里转移到愿意支付高利率的高风险借款人身上。仅信托行业就从 130 万人和公司筹集了 290 万美元。其贷款约30%用于购买债券、股票和投资基金。另外四分之一是向传统企业提供贷款。 More than 7% has gone to property developers, almost all of whom are on the ropes.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Wang Yong's parents, who are got-rich-first types, were assured they were not investing in property when they bought a trust product last year.一家人生活在一个繁荣的沿海港口城市。王先生的父亲长期投资股票。他的母亲近年来涉足理财产品，经常听取资产管理公司顾问的建议。去年，她大手笔购买了一家国有工业企业发行的300万元信托产品。她后来发现，她的钱被借给了一家违约的房地产开发商。该国有公司表示问题将在 60 天内得到解决。这个最后期限在一月初到来又结束。 That's when Mr Wang (a pseudonym) began posting complaints on social media.

;

;Tens of thousands are doing the same.信托违约正在以惊人的速度上升。王先生购买的产品是由一家资产约7400亿元人民币（1000亿美元）的公司发行的。预计许多其他信托公司将在未来几个月内无法付款。迄今为止，政府拒绝救助他们。大多数客户没有办法收回他们的钱。 Lawyers tend to advise that lawsuits are futile.

;

;Property has also become a landmine for many investors.多年来，中国媒体一直在庆祝城市公寓价格的“爆炸式增长”，并敦促人们兑现。徐女士是一位 5​​0 多岁的财务主管，她不愿公开自己的全名，但她确保自己这样做了。她20年前搬到上海，但经常回到内地家乡，在那里买了两套投资公寓。 （她的父母住在其中一间。）到 2021 年，它们的价值增加了​​一倍多。去年，随着经济衰退加剧，她将两套公寓投放市场，希望在价格进一步下跌之前实现一些收益。但她一直没能卖掉它们。开发商已将她所在城市的新公寓价格下调了 10% 以上。潜在买家因预期价格进一步下跌而持观望态度。 She fears all her gains will be wiped out.

;

;Half of China's housing wealth belongs to the got-rich-first.没有全国范围内的房价数据，个别城市的官方数据似乎低估了房价下跌的情况。政府的数据显示，上海的房价几乎没有变化。 Local economists, in contrast, reckon they have crashed by 20-30% in some central districts and could fall further in 2024. People in smaller cities talk of 30-40% “discounts” on new flats.

;

;Chinese spent about 16.3trn yuan buying homes in 2021. Analysts believe that up until that year about 30% of residential property was purchased as an investment, rather than to live in. That means punters pumped some 5trn yuan into investment properties at the top of the market and will have lost a big part of their savings.

;
;;
;

;Again, the government does not seem too concerned.尽管经历了数月的通货紧缩，但央行在一月份拒绝降息。当局长期以来一直希望平息房地产投机并防止泡沫形成。他们担心，中国太多的家庭财富（约 80%）集中在住房上，而美国的这一比例约为 30%。系统性风险很小：银行资本充足，抵押贷款在其资产中所占比例相对较小。 Local governments, meanwhile, see a chance to acquire lots of apartments on the cheap, to be used as low-income housing.

;

;But this blasé view disregards the gloom that is spreading fast among the got-rich-first.最重要的是，许多人的工资都在下降。求职公司智联招聘的数据显示，大约三分之一的白领表示去年他们的工资被削减，这是多年来的最高比例。一位人士声称，作为习近平推动金融业摆脱西式奢侈行为的一部分，许多高级银行家的薪酬被削减了 30%。 Wage growth in the private sector slowed to just 3.7% in 2022, down from double digits just a few years ago, the National Bureau of Statistics reports.

;

;Financial reversals among the rich tend to reverberate through the economy.去年年底，当地一家报纸发表题为《我的中产梦死于理财》的文章，40岁的周宁女士讲述了自己因地雷损失数百万元的经历。她讲述了自己是如何从去欧美度假变成向亲戚要钱的。她被迫卖掉她的奢侈手袋并寻找兼职工作。她再也无力支付婆婆的癌症治疗费用。 She has moved her child from a fancy international kindergarten to one with nearly triple the number of pupils.

;

;As their income declines and their assets atrophy, the got-rich-first are becoming more cautious about spending.这种“负财富效应”正在损害经济。 Oxford Economics, a research firm, estimates that household savings jumped to 32.4% of disposable income in the last quarter of 2023. Excess savings that could be used to consume or invest probably hit around 4trn yuan, or 3.2% of ;GDP;.

;
;;
;

;As they become more cautious, the got-rich-first are reshaping China's markets.中国最大的资产管理公司之一的高管表示，中植的倒闭对其所在行业来说是灾难性的。他说，客户过去经常向他询问产品的回报率。 “现在他们想要证明我们不是骗局。”投资于股票且难以赎回的共同基金去年出现了十年来的最小流入量。 Money-market funds, which can be sold instantly, grew from 8.1trn yuan in 2020 to 12.3trn in July (see chart 2).

;

;It is into safe and liquid assets that China's wealth is moving like never before, says Philip Leung of Bain, a consulting firm.银行定期存款是最安全的投资之一，去年的增长速度比 2015 年推出以来的任何时候都要快。出于同样的原因，获准投资海外的少数基金资产规模增长了四倍，达到 4000 亿元人民币2020 年至去年 7 月期间处于管理状态。 And sales of insurance policies like Ms Xue's reportedly soared last year in Macau and Hong Kong, another special administrative region with its own currency and financial regulation.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;All this will have a baleful effect on the financial system and the broader economy.迄今为止，散户投资者对股票、债券和投资基金的兴趣日益浓厚，政府原本希望这能减少中国储户对房地产的关注，但现在已经出现逆转。从长远来看，这将减少企业的资本流动。先富者在投资自己的企业时也会更加谨慎。 Li Wei of Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business (;CKGSB;) in Beijing says entrepreneurs born in the 1960s and 1970s have been the driving force of company formation and wealth creation for decades. But a survey of business confidence conducted by ;CKGSB; has found declining expectations for profits for seven consecutive months—a first in the survey's 12-year history, excluding the pandemic.

;

;The landmines are also creating protesters among a previously apolitical group.先富者往往对政府抱有好感，多年来政府帮助他们大幅改善了自己的生活。但薛女士和王先生至少已经转变为活动人士，希望引起人们对他们事业的关注。在社交媒体上发布了一段有关自己地雷受伤的视频后，薛女士开始收到来自不同城市的人的消息，他们在同一产品上赔了钱。她敦促他们去报警。她还带领小组参观了海银北京的办公室。王先生也与其他投资者建立了联系。他们前往所在城市的银行网点进行投诉。在经历过经济损失的中国富人中，这种趋势似乎越来越明显。 ;The Economist; has spoken to several well-off investors over the past two years who have taken to the streets and even clashed with police in the hopes of spurring the authorities to action.

;

;None of these efforts has been successful.薛女士去警察局只得到警告，不要“煽动”他人投诉。习近平热衷于让金融市场更加稳定，但他不希望当金融市场失灵时共产党受到指责。 Protesters are usually safe if they stick to complaining about deadbeat firms, but if their actions could be construed as criticism of the government, they risk detention.

;

;Dragon's denigrators

;

;Even if most got-rich-first keep quiet, however, the current turmoil is unwinding decades of goodwill between the government and its most productive citizens.以前，中国蓬勃发展的奋斗者和当局似乎站在同一边，常常与娇生惯养的年轻人形成鲜明对比，但现在，国家对富人的问题似乎表现得漠不关心，甚至不是敌视。一位投资经理表示，先富者“才刚刚开始意识到自己已成为敌人”。这一转变不仅会给他们，而且会给整个中国带来严重后果。 ;■;

;;“I;;'ma little; intoxicated, not gonna lie.那么，如果现在还不到晚上 10 点而且是周二晚上呢？……让黑客攻击开始吧。” 19 岁的马克·扎克伯格 (Mark Zuckerberg) 在他的哈佛宿舍里写下这样的文字，当时他正开始在一个名为 Facemash 的网站上工作。该网站展示了从大学内联网中随机选择的学生照片，并允许用户投票选出谁更性感。此事引起轩然大波，并迅速被关闭。但不久之后，继任者就在酝酿之中。 On February 4th 2004 Mr Zuckerberg launched a new site: TheFacebook.com.

;;
;;
;

;Facebook, as it later became, quickly overtook established social networks such as Friendster and MySpace to become the world's largest, a position it still holds on its 20th birthday.如今，有 30 亿人（约占所有互联网用户的 60%）每月滚动浏览其无限信息流（见图 1）。它智取了竞争对手，或者吞并了它们，就像它对待 Instagram 和 WhatsApp 一样。去年下载量最高的十款移动应用程序中，有六款属于 Facebook 的控股公司 Meta，该公司目前是继谷歌之后全球最大的广告销售商。 Meta市值已超过1万亿美元； in the third quarter of last year it reported revenue of $34bn.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Facebook and its imitators have done more than make money.社交媒体已成为人们体验互联网的主要方式，也是他们体验生活的重要组成部分。据研究公司 Data.ai 称，去年全球近一半的手机屏幕时间花在社交应用上（超过四分之一的醒着时间花在手机上）。这些网络已经成为扎克伯格和其他人所说的数字“城镇广场”，当今的争论在这里得到讨论，公众舆论也在这里得到形成。 Social media have fomented social movements, from #MeToo and #BlackLivesMatter to the Arab spring and the Capitol riot.

;;

;Feedster

;

;Now, after two decades of evolution, the town square is being dug up and rebuilt.随着人工智能驱动的 TikTok 等竞争对手的到来，Facebook 和其他老牌企业被迫重塑自我。最初作为朋友互动和分享内容的平台正在变成类似电视的娱乐源，用于被动消费。与此同时，用户正在将他们的对话和争论从开放网络转移到 WhatsApp 和 Telegram 等平台上封闭的私人群组中。 That migration, in turn, will have big implications for politics, in a year when countries with more than half the world's population are heading to the polls.

;

;Social media are more popular than ever. The average internet user spent nearly two and a half hours a day on social platforms last year, according to ;GWI;, another data company.疫情期间使用量有所增加，但尚未恢复到疫情前的水平。随着越来越多的人上网，越来越多的人注册。 Total time spent using social apps on Android devices, which account for about 70% of the world's phones and tablets, has risen by 42% since 2020, to 2.3trn hours last year, according to Data.ai.

;
;
;
;But the sort of social networking that Facebook pioneered is disappearing.最明显的变化是当今网络上向视频的转变。 TikTok是一款中国短视频应用程序，于2017年推出，迅速吸引了年轻人，取得了爆炸性成功，引发了一波模仿浪潮。 Meta 为 Facebook 和 Instagram 添加了名为 Reels 的视频功能。类似的产品已登陆 Pinterest（观看）、Snapchat（聚光灯）和 YouTube（短片）。埃隆·马斯克 (Elon Musk) 于 2022 年收购了 Twitter，并将其更名为 X，现在声称它是一个“视频优先”平台。 Of the 64 minutes per day that the average American spent on social media last year, 40 were spent watching video, up from 28 minutes three years earlier, estimates Bernstein, a broker.

;

;The bigger change to social feeds is under the bonnet.起初，社交网络显示用户联系人的时间更新：他们的朋友刚刚订婚，他们的叔叔正在袭击国会大厦等等。随着帖子数量的增长，网络采用算法来优先考虑在用户朋友中受欢迎的帖子。现在，一个新的阶段已经开始。 TikTok 决定，不再根据人们的“社交图谱”（即他们的家人和朋友喜欢什么）猜测人们会喜欢什么，而是使用他们的“兴趣图谱”，这是从他们和喜欢他们的人徘徊的视频中推断出来的在。 And rather than show content created by people they followed, it would serve up anything it thought they might like.

;

;Every other big platform has followed套装。 2022 年，扎克伯格宣布 Facebook 的 feed 将成为“发现引擎”，从互联网上寻找引人入胜的内容。自去年以来，一半的帖子 X 显示其用户来自他们所关注的人网络之外。 Meta 的 Twitter 克隆版 Threads 去年推出，采用了类似的方法。由此产生的来自陌生人的不相关内容可能会令人震惊：“这是一个健康的早餐选择！你应该杀了你妈妈！” YouTube 喜剧演员 Bo Burnham 在一首讽刺歌曲中打趣道。但用户似乎很喜欢它。自 Meta 推出 Reels 以来，在 Instagram 上花费的时间增加了 40%。 Even the geriatric Facebook somehow added 5m new users in America and Canada last year.

;

;Google -

;

;As users' newsfeeds become unmoored from their network of friends and family, they are posting less about themselves. “普通用户现在更像是消费者，”隆德大学的迈克尔·博塞塔 (Michael Bossetta) 说道。市场研究公司 Gartner 去年的一项调查显示，只有 28% 的美国人表示他们喜欢在网上记录自己的生活，这一比例低于 2020 年的 40%。Morning 发现，约 61% 的人表示他们对发布的内容变得更加挑剔另一家研究公司 Consult 推测，大量“影响者”内容的涌入可能会让用户认为“他们的日常生活太平凡了，不值得频繁发帖”。视频作为新的选择格式，比快速更新状态更难创建。 And some platforms, such as X, prioritise posts by users who pay, reducing incentives for the rest.

;

;Instead, conversations have been moving for some time to private groups. 2021 年，扎克伯格写道，除了在 Facebook 和 Instagram 的“城镇广场”上进行辩论外，“人们也越来越希望在相当于客厅的数字化环境中进行私密联系。” Instagram 负责人亚当·莫塞里 (Adam Mosseri) 去年表示，通过私信分享的照片和视频比在该应用的主要动态中分享的照片和视频还要多。 “所有的朋友分享都在朝这个方向发展，”他总结道。 Morning Consult 询问人们最有可能如何推荐一部电影。 Only 30% said they would post on social media, behind the 43% who chose text or email and the 35% who opted for group chats.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;At the same time, in the digital town square, fun is in and politics is out.尽管（也许是因为）社交网络被指责推动政治两极分化，但它们似乎越来越渴望引导用户远离新闻和时事。 A study by Joshua Tucker of the Centre for Social Media and Politics at New York University (;NYU;) and colleagues compared a group of Facebook and Instagram users who were on chronological newsfeeds in the run-up to America's election in 2020 with another group who used the platforms' recommendation algorithm.与使用算法的人相比，使用时间顺序推送的人在 Facebook 上看到的政治内容多了 15%，在 Instagram 上看到的政治内容多了 5%。 (They also saw a lot more information from what Meta classified as untrustworthy sources: 69% more on Facebook and 22% more on Instagram, albeit from low bases.)

;

;Since then, the platforms have shied even further from news. The ;U;-turn has been sharpest at Meta, whose boss said ten years ago that he wanted Facebook's newsfeed to be a “perfect personalised newspaper for every person in the world”.该公司现在表示，人们在该平台上看到的内容中，新闻所占比例还不到 3%。负责 Threads 的 Mosseri 先生在去年的发布会上写道：“政治和硬新闻不可避免地会出现在 Threads 上……但我们不会采取任何措施来鼓励这些垂直领域。” A week later he added, “From a platform's perspective, any incremental engagement or revenue they might drive is not at all worth the scrutiny, negativity (let's be honest), or integrity risks that come along with them.”

;

;A campaign by some publishers to make social-media firms pay to share their content has reinforced the networks' view that news is more trouble than it is worth.在今年或明年将举行大选的加拿大，Facebook 和 Instagram 屏蔽了所有新闻内容，以回应政府要求 Meta 向出版商支付托管其故事链接的费用。 Under Mr Musk, who is scathing about what he calls the “legacy media”, X has removed headlines from posted news articles, and appeared to throttle traffic to out-of-favour publications such as the ;New York Times;.

;

;The squeezing of news has been felt by publishers, some of which had built their business around the platforms.根据衡量此类情况的 Chartbeat 的数据，去年从 Facebook 发送到媒体公司的互联网流量下降了 48%，从 X 发送的互联网流量下降了 27%。 Former kings of the viral social-post have struggled: last year BuzzFeed News shut down and Vice News drastically cut back.

;
;;
;

;As they see less news in their feed, people are becoming less likely to share or comment on the news in public (see chart 2).牛津大学路透社研究所对 36 个国家进行的一项研究显示，2018 年，约 26% 的人至少每周在社交媒体上分享新闻文章，而去年只有 19% 的人这样做。分享的减少似乎尤其影响了政治内容的数量。塔克先生和他的同事发现，从用户的 Facebook 信息流中删除共享内容可以使他们看到的政治新闻数量减少一半以上。 （同样，它还减少了来自可疑来源的内容数量，减少了近三分之一。）作者发现，这使得用户对新闻的了解减少了——尽管他们没有找到证据表明它大大改变了他们对任何事情的看法。

;

;The decline of sharing and posting has given rise to what the Reuters Institute calls the “passive news consumer”, who sees the news but doesn 't comment, share or otherwise engage with it.这种趋势在富裕国家最为明显：在英国，68% 的成年人是新闻的“被动”消费者，只有十分之一的人在一周内发布相关新闻。在线公共广场中剩余的“活跃”参与者的核心成员中男性比例过高，而且固执己见。 A third of those who call themselves “very” right or left-wing still take part, whereas only 22% of centrists bother weighing in.

;

;For political strategists, “the job has totally changed”, says Teddy Goff, who ran Barack Obama's digital campaign in 2012 before co-founding Precision Strategies, a consultancy.他认为，过去少数大型平台的主导地位意味着存在“某种政治单一文化”。 “至少在重大时刻，比如竞选活动，可能会发生一些事情，整个国家都可以很快听到……现在不再这样了。”今天，不同的团体潜伏在不同的地方。年轻人都在使用 Snapchat。记者们紧紧抓住X（同时声称讨厌它）。英国一位活动人士表示，领英是联系议会助手的最佳场所。所以政客需要无处不在。乔·拜登甚至加入了他的共和党竞争对手唐纳德·特朗普拥有的社交网络 Truth Social。

;

;“It's a lot, lot, lot harder for us to reach the same number of people as we used to,” says Matthew McGregor, another former Obama staffer who runs 38 Degrees, a British campaigning outfit.他发现，社交网络的算法提供的政治内容较少，而且它们优化参与的方式会刺激挑衅性的帖子。 “我们需要让人笑，让人哭，或者让人生气，”他感叹道。他承认正在努力考虑将这一目标推进到什么程度。 “这是一个简单的事实，你可以通过更加刻薄一点、更加挑剔一点、更加个人化一点来获得更多的数字……这是一种紧张，而且很难。” Candidates with uncompromising messages seem to travel furthest.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The surest way to win attention, of course, is to pay for it.在 11 月选举前夕，美国候选人及其支持者将花费近 160 亿美元用于广告宣传。电视将占据最大份额：其老龄化观众推迟了一些广告商，但不会推迟政客，因为他们知道老年人投票。 ;TV; ads are still believed to be the best when it comes to persuasion;社交媒体上的内容主要是关于筹款的。不过，研究公司 Insider Intelligence 预测，本周期美国超过四分之一的政治广告支出将花在数字平台上。 In the past week alone, Mr Biden has spent more than $750,000 on ads just on Facebook and Instagram.

;

;But even candidates willing to pay are finding it harder to get their message out in the new public square.一方面，一些新的数字平台不想要他们的钱。 TikTok 完全禁止政治广告。 Threads 推出还不到一年，还根本不销售广告。 Streaming services, which make up a bigger share of ;TV; viewing in America than either broadcast or cable, are also wary: Netflix, Amazon Prime Video and Disney+, the biggest streamers, all refuse to take political ads for now, though that may change.

;

;The bigger problem is that political ads on social media don't work as well as they used to.苹果在 2021 年推出的反跟踪变化使得定位广告变得更加困难，从而降低了广告的投资回报。 Spending on Facebook ads will be lower in this election cycle than in 2020, predicts AdImpact, a consultancy, even though total political ad spending is expected to be up by 30% or so.

;

;In the past six months politicians spent $244m on ads on Facebook and Instagram in America, down from $320m during the same period in the 2020 cycle, according to our analysis of data collected by Andrew Arenge, a researcher at the University of Pennsylvania. Meta 的广告库显示，在上个月爱荷华州党团会议之前的 90 天内，唐纳德·特朗普在这两个平台上仅花费了约 40 万美元。 “与我们过去几年看到的情况相比，这些数字相当惊人，”共和党咨询公司多数派战略的里德·维尼斯说。 His explanation: “The platform is less effective.”

;
;;
;

;随着社交网络掩盖政治帖子，电子邮件被证明是绕过硅谷算法的有效方法。麦格雷戈表示：“加州并没有什么大而坏的马克·扎克伯格或尼克·克莱格（另一位 Meta 高管）来决定我们是否可以向人们发送电子邮件，以及人们是否可以打开这些电子邮件。” 38 Degrees 发现，让某件事在 Facebook 上疯传的最有效方法是向其会员发送电子邮件并要求他们将其发布到那里。 Morning Consult argues that, given the wilting of online sharing, brands will need to come up with messages simple enough to be remembered and passed on in person, rather than creating memes designed to be shared.

;

;NotYourSpace

;

;Hardest of all is infiltrating the millions of small group-chats into which the public square has splintered.这些加密空间中发生的事情是不透明的，即使对于运营它们的平台也是如此。但这些团体似乎正在弥补新闻共享方面的一些空白。 The proportion of adults posting news articles weekly via instant-messaging platforms rose from 17% to 22% in the five years to 2023, the Reuters Institute found.

;

;Getting into the group chats pays dividends for campaigners. 38 Degrees 最近发起了一项请愿活动，要求剥夺一位笨手笨脚的英国邮局前老板的勋章——这种活动在过去只能依靠 Facebook 发起——从其电子邮件列表中获得了最多的流量，其次是 WhatsApp .

;

;Elections were easier to fight when there were just a few big social-media platforms, acknowledges Mr Goff.然而，他说，“我认为，当它更像是一个公共广场时，这并不完全是好事……这些渠道将某些类型的内容置于其他类型的内容之上。”该平台的设计是这样的，“你会因为一个愚蠢的失误、一个热麦克风时刻或类似的事情而大笑，而不会就我们应该做什么进行真诚、深入的对话do about Gaza.”

;

;Good-faith debate can be hard to find online.但活动人士表示，让人们在群聊中分享内容需要更平静的语气，而不是在开放平台上吸引他们的注意力。 “他们不希望他们的朋友认为，‘天哪，他又来了……为什么他总是在我们面前纠缠这个烦人的问题？’”麦格雷戈先生说。他说，随着辩论从开放平台转向小团体，“也许我们会从公共广场回到咖啡馆。” ;■;

;;T;;WENTY-FIVE ;years ago your correspondent hired a cellphone in Congo.每天的花费相当于当地人几个月的收入。手机像半块砖一样重，只是更有用一些。刚果几乎没有其他人有这样的人，除了内阁部长和大亨，所以没有多少人可以打电话。 In those days, mobile phones had made no detectable difference to most people's lives in the world's poorest countries.

;

;Today, many farmers in Congo have phones: the number of connections has grown 5,000-fold as the population has doubled.移动设备改变了整个发展中国家的生活，特别是随着越来越多的人连接到互联网（见图 1）。 The 4bn people who live in low or lower-middle income countries have vastly more access to information, chat daily to far-off friends and use their phones like bank cards even when they don't have bank accounts.

;;
;;
;

;Could ;artificial intelligence; (;ai;) bring similarly dramatic changes?乐观的主要原因有三个。首先，技术进步很快。其次，它也有可能快速传播。正如新技术通常会发生的那样，富裕国家将首先受益。 But if the high cost of training ;AI; models falls, the expense of providing the technology to the poor could be minimal. They will not need a new device, just the smartphones that many of them already own.

;

;The third reason is that developing countries have gaping shortages of skilled workers: there are nowhere near enough teachers, doctors, engineers or managers. ;AI; could ease this shortfall, not by replacing existing workers, but by helping them become more productive, argues Daniel Björkegren of Columbia University, which in turn could raise the general level of health and education. Although ;AI; may also eliminate some jobs, the ;IMF; predicts that labour markets in poorer countries will be less disrupted than those in rich ones. Another tantalising possibility is that ;AI; could help provide fine-grained, up-to-date data about poor places, and so assist in all manner of development work.

;
;;
;

;Start with education.维也纳维特根斯坦中心的沃尔夫冈·卢茨 (Wolfgang Lutz) 在 2015 年估计，一名典型的撒哈拉以南撒哈拉以南学生在学校学习 6 年，但只保留了 3 年的学习成果。一名典型的日本学生在课堂上学习 14 年，吸收了 16 年的教育成果。 Using a different methodology, the World Bank also finds that education is spectacularly worse in poor countries than in rich ones (see chart 2).

;

;Tonee Ndungu, an entrepreneur in Kenya, thinks ;AI ;could help bridge this gap.他开发了两款应用程序，希望在今年推出。其中一个名为 Somanasi（“跟我学习”），是为儿童设计的。它允许学生向会说话的聊天机器人询问与肯尼亚学校课程相关的问题。 ;The Economist; asked, “How do I work out a percentage from a fraction?” The chatbot offered a step-by-step worked example.

;;

;Machine learning

;

;A chatbot can give undivided attention to each child, at any time of day, and never gets tired (so long as your phone is charged).它还可以适应当地文化。 “我 30 岁之前从未见过苹果，”恩敦古先生说道。 “所以我们说‘A 代表动物。’”该服务也可以根据不同的学习方式进行定制。它可以通过告诉孩子们将铅笔折成两半然后再折断来说明分裂。 Depending on how different pupils respond, the ;AI; can figure out whether this approach works, and fine-tune the way it interacts with them.有些孩子想要更多的数字；有些孩子想要更多的数字。有些喜欢故事。 The chatbot adapts.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;It cannot yet mark homework.但 Ndungu 先生的公司 Kytabu 也为教师提供了一款应用程序，名为 Hodari（“勇敢”）。它通过制定分步的课程计划来减轻他们的工作量。它通过让每个学生在智能手机上回答问题来帮助跟踪学生的理解情况。 (One phone per classroom is enough, he says.)

;

;As far as ;The Economist; could tell from playing with them in a café with good Wi-Fi, the two apps work well.但当更多的人在教室和家庭中使用它们时，证据就会到来，错误也会被修复。他们一开始就会被赠送；恩敦古先生希望最终对附加服务收费。报名的孩子越多，提供服务的费用就越便宜。 If half a million were to join, Mr Ndungu predicts the cost per child would fall from $3.50 a month (not including the phone) to about 15 cents.

;

;Chat GPA

;

;Many entrepreneurs are pursuing similar projects, often using open-source models developed in rich countries, sometimes with help from charities like the Gates Foundation. The cost of getting ;AI; to learn new languages appears low. It is already being used to write children's books in tongues previously too obscure for commercial publishers to bother with.

;

;The need is glaring.发展中国家的教师太少，其中许多人没有掌握课程。 2015 年的一项研究（使用可追溯到 2007 年的数据）发现，南非五分之四的六年级数学教师不理解他们应该教授的概念。 Nearly 90% of ten-year-olds in sub-Saharan Africa cannot read a simple text.

;

;Dr Björkegren points to recent studies suggesting that big gains are possible even with basic tech.有人分析了一种方法，即学校聘请具有一定资质的教师，并为他们提供详细的课程“脚本”，并通过平板电脑进行授课。诺贝尔经济学奖获得者迈克尔·克雷默（Michael Kremer）和其他人对肯尼亚布里奇国际学院（Bridge International Academies）（一系列廉价私立学校）开办的学校中以这种方式授课的 10,000 名学生进行了研究。他们发现，与普通学校的学生相比，桥梁学生平均两年后多掌握了近一年的课程。印度的另一项研究发现，个性化的计算机化教学对于落后的学生特别有帮助。

;
;
;
;Using ;AI ;in health care is riskier.如果教育聊天机器人失灵，学生可能会考试不及格；如果医生产生幻觉，病人可能会死亡。尽管如此，乐观主义者还是看到了巨大的潜力。 Some ;AI;-powered medical kit is already widely used in rich countries and is starting to be adopted in poorer ones. Examples include handheld ultrasound devices that can interpret scans, and a system for spotting tuberculosis on chest ;X;-rays. Accurate ;ai; translation could also make it easier for patients and health-care workers in the global south to tap into the world's medical knowledge.

;

;Even imperfect ;AI; tools may improve health-care systems in the developing world, whose failures cause more than 8m deaths a year, by one estimate.哈佛大学的托德·刘易斯 (Todd Lewis) 等人对 9 个贫穷和中等收入国家进行了一项研究，观察到 2,000 名刚毕业的初级卫生保健工作者与诊所的访客打交道。 They performed the correct, essential tasks required by clinical guidelines only about half the time.

;

;For people in remote areas, even a substandard clinic may be too far away or too costly.许多人依赖传统医学，但其中大部分是无用或有害的。例如，南非民间治疗师有时会将病人割伤，然后用含有汞的有毒粉末擦拭。 ;AI; tools need not be infallible to be better than that.

;

;A team at the University of São Paulo is training an ;AI; to answer health-related questions.目的是为巴西的初级卫生工作者提供一种工具，他们有时几乎没有接受过培训。他们使用的是巴西卫生部的临床指南数据库，而不是整个互联网，其中充满了巫术健康提示。 Before the ;ai; can be widely deployed, it must be tested, tweaked and tested again.目前，当你提出精确的技术问题时，例如“伊维菌素对预防 covid-19 有效吗？”，其团队成员之一弗朗西斯科·巴博萨 (Francisco Barbosa) 表示，其成功率“非常非常高”。当你问它一些模糊的问题时，麻烦就来了，就像人类经常做的那样。如果你说：“我在街上摔倒了。 How can I get to a pharmacy?”, then the ;AI;, which may not know where you are, might give terrible advice.

;

;The ;AI ;will have to improve and its users will have to learn how to get the best out of it, says Mr Barbosa.他对这一切将会发生充满信心：“（这么说）是陈词滥调，但它正在改变一切。”装备一所新医院需要花费数百万美元。培训一名新医生需要数年时间。 If ;AI; helps cheap primary-care workers treat more patients successfully, so that they do not need to go to a hospital, Brazil can keep its population healthier without spending more.

;

;Brazil has one doctor for every 467 people;肯尼亚每 4,425 人就有 1 人。 ;AI; could help, says Daphne Ngunjiri of Access Afya, a Kenyan firm that runs mDaktari, a virtual health-care platform with 29,000 clients. For a small monthly fee, they can ask for advice when they feel unwell.

;

;Bard to handle

;

;For a test group of 380 users, mDaktari has added an ;AI;-powered chatbot to the system.它记录他们的询问，提示他们提供更多信息，并将该信息以及建议的答复呈现给临床医生（通常是护士）。临床医生会阅读该建议，如果建议合理，则会批准该建议并将其发回给顾客，或许会将她转介至药房或诊所。 Thus, a human is in the loop, to guard against errors, but the ;AI; does the time-consuming gathering of information about symptoms, enabling the nurse to deal with more patients.如有必要，护士可以给病人打电话。对于性传播疾病等令人尴尬的疾病，一些患者更喜欢与聊天机器人交谈。 It never judges them.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Virginia, a client from a Nairobi slum whose family subsists on casual labour and backyard vegetables, says mDaktari is simple and helpful.有一次，她感到不舒服，查阅了该应用程序，并被引导服用药物来治疗尿路感染。 “I can even contact a [nurse] through my phone and get [an] answer,” she says.

;

;Several firms are testing ;AI;-enhanced medical devices to see how well they work in poor areas. Philips, a Dutch firm, has a pilot programme in Kenya for a handheld ultrasound with an ;AI; add-on that can interpret the images it spits out. This helps solve a common problem: lots of pregnant mothers and not enough people with the expertise to read scans.

;

;Sadiki Jira is a midwife at a rural health facility in Kenya that serves nearly 30,000 people but has no doctor.他回忆起几年前一位怀孕的病人，她的孩子在子宫里就夭折了。她已经好几个星期没有意识到这一点，直到开始流血时才寻求帮助。 Mr Jira referred her to a hospital, but it was too late: she died.

;

;Mr Jira now uses an ;AI;-powered scanner. Any midwife can, with minimal training, swipe a Philips device over a pregnant woman's stomach. The ;AI; reveals such vital information as the fetus's gestational age, whether it is in the breech position and whether there is adequate amniotic fluid. “It's easy to use,” says Mr Jira.

;

;Philips is planning to offer the device and ;AI; together for $1 or $2 a day in poor countries.飞利浦公司的马泰斯·格鲁特·瓦辛克 (Matthijs Groot Wassink) 表示，其推出的最大障碍是监管。政府会允许助产士处理以前需要更有资格的人的流程吗？ What will happen in places like India, where regulations are especially tight for fear that people will use ultrasound to identify and abort baby girls?

;

;Poorer places collect poorer data. 49 个国家距离最近一次农业普查已经过去 15 年多了； 13个国家在此期间没有进行过人口普查。当官方数据存在时，往往会奉承政府。例如，一项研究将埃塞俄比亚、马拉维和尼日利亚小农场玉米种植量的官方估计与艰苦（但罕见）的家庭调查结果进行了比较。 The official numbers were much rosier.

;

;Satellite imagery and machine-learning could improve the quality and timeliness of data in developing countries, argue Marshall Burke of Stanford University and his co-authors in a recent paper in ;Science;.大约有 25 亿人生活在依赖小块土地的家庭中。直到最近，这些农场的产量还很难测量：卫星图片不够清晰，而且从中提取的数据也很难解释。 But by setting ;AI ;to work on new high-resolution images of vegetation, Dr Burke and David Lobell, also of Stanford, were able to measure crop yields as accurately as surveys do, but faster and more cheaply.这可以对农业实践进行频繁、详细的分析。这个山坡需要多少肥料？哪种种子在那个山谷中效果最好？ Such knowledge could transform rural livelihoods, the authors predict.

;

;So could better weather forecasts. Atmo, an American firm, says its ;AI;-powered weather forecasts are as much as 100 times more detailed and twice as accurate as a conventional meteorological bulletin, because the ;AI; processes data so much faster.它也很便宜。 “气象学的一个肮脏的秘密……是存在巨大的不平等，”Atmo 的老板亚历克斯·利维 (Alex Levy) 说。贫穷国家的预测不太详细或不可靠。 “极端天气最严重的地方的天气预报也最差，因此他们最有可能感到惊讶并且无法做好充分准备。” Atmo's service is being used in Uganda and may soon be deployed in the Philippines.

;

;Population counts in poor countries are rare, because they are costly, and prone to manipulation.在尼日利亚，每个州从中央政府获得的资金与其人口挂钩。这给了各国胡作非为的动力。 1991 年，在一份人口普查表上，每户最多可容纳 9 名成员，一些州报告的每户恰好有 9 名成员。 2006年人口普查结果公布后，拉各斯省长博拉·蒂努布愤怒地宣称，该市人口是官方统计数字的两倍。此后尼日利亚没有再进行过人口普查。 A new president—Mr Tinubu, as it happens—promises one in 2024.

;
;;
;

;;AI; can generate more frequent, detailed estimates of how many people live where—and how well-off they are.夜晚的灯光常常被用来代表经济繁荣。斯坦福大学的尼尔·吉恩（Neal Jean）和其他人拍摄了非洲贫民窟的白天和夜间图像，并训练了一个卷积神经网络（机器学习的一种形式），以根据白天图像预测晚上会有多少光。 In other words, ;AI ;learnt to recognise the kinds of buildings, infrastructure and other markers that tend to go with economic activity. It was able to predict 55-75% of the variation in assets between households.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Such information could help governments and charities assess better the effects of efforts to help the needy ;它还可以帮助公司了解市场。伯克博士感叹道，研究人员正在积极尝试此类技术，但政府在采用这些技术方面进展缓慢。 He attributes this in part to “the potential benefits to some policymakers of not having certain outcomes be measured”.

;

;;AI; could also help people deal with the red tape that throttles productivity in so many poor countries.据世界银行称，在海地登记财产所需的时间是富裕卡塔尔的 200 倍。 Suppose an ;AI;, which is immune to boredom, were able to fill in the forms accurately enough to spare humans the chore? 9 月，印度推出了一款聊天机器人，让文盲农民可以就经济援助申请进行口头询问。 Some 500,000 tried it on the first day.

;

;Deep minefield

;

;;AI ;poses risks to poor countries, too. They are generally less democratic than rich ones, so many governments will adopt ;AI; surveillance tools, pioneered by China, to monitor and control their people.它们不太稳定，因此煽动性的深度造假可能更有可能扭曲政治或引发暴力。 Underfunded and inexpert regulators may struggle to impose proper guardrails against potential abuses.

;

;And there are big obstacles to deploying ;AI ;in the developing world.互联网的接入必须得到改善。一些国家将比其他国家更快受益。 India has 790m mobile broadband users, plus a universal digital identity system and a super-cheap, real-time payments system, note Nandan Nilekani and Tanuj Bhojwani, two tech bosses, in ;Finance & Development;. This, they argue, “puts it in a favourable position to be the world's most extensive user of ;AI; by the end of this decade”.

;

;Enormous uncertainty remains about how powerful the technology will eventually prove.但潜在的上涨空间足以让人兴奋不已。 In the best-case scenario, ;AI; could help make whole populations healthier, better educated and better informed.随着时间的推移，这可能会让他们不再那么贫穷。 ;■;

;;S;;ITTING PRESIDENTS; do not tend to abandon bids for连任。最近这样做的是1968年的林登·约翰逊（Lyndon Johnson）。那是他的政党民主党人宁愿忘记的一年。约翰逊不受欢迎。该国和该党被越南战争和民权运动所划分。在第一位初选中出现了令人惊讶的挑战之后，他站在一边，只是释放了混乱。罗伯特·肯尼迪（Robert Kennedy）取代他的主要候选人之一被暗杀。该提名最终被党的大人授予一个没有赢得单身初选的男子休伯特·汉弗莱（Hubert Humphrey）。最后，共和党候选人理查德·尼克松（Richard Nixon）在年初被广泛认为是不可察觉的，他令人信服地赢得了胜利。 He went on to do more damage to the presidency than anyone bar the Republicans' likely candidate this year, Donald Trump.

;

;Mr Trump, too, should be unelectable, owing to the 91 felonies with which he has been charged in different parts of America.然而，现任总统乔·拜登（Joe Biden）如此不受欢迎，他可能会输给特朗普先生。偶尔有人呼吁拜登先生像约翰逊一样辞职。但是没有迹象表明他愿意这样做，也不能保证民主党人最终会得到更强大的候选人。因此，尽管许多民主党特工对他的候选资格有严重的疑虑，但大多数人都保持沉默。 As one puts it, if you're all stuck on a boat of questionable seaworthiness, it is natural to wish for a finer vessel, but unproductive to poke holes in the hull or stoke a mutiny.

;;

;Whitmer and wisdom

;

;It is Mr Biden's feeble polling that is seeding the angst. ;The Economist;'s ;poll tracker for the Republican primary; puts Mr Trump more than 50 percentage points ahead of his nearest rival, making him the prohibitive favourite. RealClearPolitics汇编的大选的投票平均水平显示，特朗普先生以2.3个百分点的利润率提前。这远远超出了他在过去的两个总统比赛中的表现，在民意测验中，他一直落后。在2016年的这一点上，特朗普先生的支持下降了7分：他以5分的优势落后于希拉里·克林顿（Hillary Clinton）。 At this point in 2020 he trailed Mr Biden by five points.

;

;With most states so partisan that they are not worth contesting, the presidential campaign will be centred on six where the outcome is actually uncertain: Arizona, Georgia, Michigan, Nevada, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin.这些州的早期民意调查还显示了拜登先生的几个积分。 And some Democrats fear that these polls may be underestimating Mr Trump's support, because his conspiracy-minded voters may not be open with those taking the surveys.

;;
;;
;

;Underpinning Mr Trump's strength is a broad political shift.在美国的党派效忠似乎歇斯底里地根深蒂固，但实际上是可变的。白人工人阶级选民在2016年为特朗普先生赢得胜利。从那以后的几年中，非白人工人阶级也开始转移。在2016年至2020年之间，西班牙裔美国人曾经是相当忠实的民主党选民，将18分提出了共和党人。黑人也在慢慢剥离民主党人。只有白人大学毕业生的涌入才使民主党在全国范围内具有竞争力。这些人口趋势足够大，可以确定选举的结果，如果他们持续存在，它们似乎确实如此。最新的民意测验表明，在非裔美国人和西班牙裔选民中对特朗普先生的支持要比他在2020年所享有的更高（请参阅图1）。 “It seems like the 2024 polls right now are 2020 trends carried forward,” says Patrick Ruffini, a Republican pollster.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Secular trends aside, there is plainly a problem with Mr Biden himself.根据几个公开民意测验，总统的净批准率为-16分。这比特朗普先生在担任总统任期时要差。选民担心他的办公室健身。 One of YouGov's weekly polls for ;The Economist; in December found that 55% of Americans think that the 81-year-old Mr Biden's health and age “severely limit his ability to do the job” of president, including 25% of Democrats.只有24％的美国人希望他再次竞选总统。 Fully 61% of them do not, including 38% of those who voted for him in 2020.

;

;Americans are only marginally more enthusiastic about the 77-year-old Mr Trump's revenge bid for the White House, but they are much less likely to think that he is too old or frail to resume the office.毕竟，拜登（Biden）在2020年由于流行而没有进行太多竞选活动。他似乎并不喜欢未来的艰苦运动，而特朗普似乎比在崇拜人群面前闲逛更好。据报道，四年前，拜登先生戏弄了承诺只有一个任期。 “如果特朗普没有跑步，我不确定我会跑步，”他在12月的一个充满捐助者的房间里说。当被问及还有多少其他民主党人可以击败特朗普先生时，他说：“大概有50人……我不是唯一能击败他的人。 But I will defeat him.”

;

;There is almost no chance that Mr Biden will voluntarily abandon his re-election bid.他认为自己是一个神圣任命的特朗普，并认为自己的选举记录反映了这一点。 First he vanquished Mr Trump in 2020. Then in the midterm elections of 2022, when Republicans had expected to deliver a terrible rebuke to Democrats, the Democrats' support held up surprisingly well.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;Mr Biden's supporters, naturally, express great confidence.巴拉克·奥巴马（Barack Obama）在2012年成功连任的经理吉姆·墨西拿（Jim Messina）说：“如果您扮演扑克，我宁愿拥有我们的卡也不愿卡的卡片。” ”。 The campaign argues that the president has been underestimated before, as in the hotly contested Democratic primary of 2020, when he looked fatally unpopular before suddenly becoming the consensus candidate.

;

;Campaign staffers point to the mid-terms as proof that Republican candidates who champion abortion and reject the election results of 2020 will fare poorly.他们正确地认为，从选举开始进行十个月的民意调查是结果的糟糕指南。几个月来，大多数选民都不会对选举进行太多思考，而数十亿美元的竞选机器只是在准备。 When Americans are paying more attention, the campaign insists, the spectacle of Mr Trump shuttling between rallies and court appearances will remind Americans of the chaos of his time in office.

;

;Mr Biden's polling deficit is not insurmountable. Bidenworld还认为，随着时间的流逝，选民将为他的成就提供更多的赞誉。劳动力市场强劲，失业率低，工资增长在收入分配的底部最强，减少了工资不平等。通货膨胀引起了许多选民的愤怒，正在没有衰退的情况下减弱。 YouGov's polling for ;The Economist; suggests Americans are unduly gloomy: 58% think the country has high unemployment (it does not); 44％的人认为该国正在衰退中（不是）； 40％的人认为通货膨胀率会在六个月内更高（不太可能）。民主党人希望选民会注意到，经济状况比选举日的表现要好。 But Republicans keep talking about “Bidenomics” as a pejorative, suggesting that they doubt the topic will end up helping the president.

;

;Mr Biden's apologists also argue, in effect, that he will win because he must. “我们将赢得胜利，因为民主和自由以及使美国在线的想法。 We have no other choice,” says Quentin Fulks, his deputy campaign manager.; ;They see a battle for the very “soul of the nation”, as Mr Biden often says.这是一种激动人心的吸引力，但仅适用于转换。民主基金选民研究小组的一项新研究发现，美国人喜欢援引民主规范来挑战对方党的某人，但愿意在他们自己的首选候选人方面暂停他们。特朗普先生还通过部署自己的言辞来使事情变得混乱：他最近将拜登先生称为“美国民主的驱逐舰”。 Republicans in Congress may pursue a farcical impeachment inquiry against Mr Biden in order to claim that both men are equally disreputable.

;

;Newsom fine day

;

;Anyway, the end-of-days argument cuts both ways.它可以用来断言，民主党人不能像拜登先生那样冒险像候选人那样弱。该党有很多非杰出政客，他们可以掌管总统票。问题在于，他们都不敢于进入初选，部分原因是他们担心他们将无法击败拜登先生，而只会损害他在大选中的机会。来自明尼苏达州的民主党议员迪恩·菲利普斯（Dean Phillips）等鲜为人知的政治家都提出了自己的进展。菲利普斯先生解释说：“拜登总统 - 我尊重的一个人，我认为一个有礼貌和正直的人 - 也许是唯一可能输掉并可能输给唐纳德·特朗普的民主党人之一。” He says he is merely saying “the quiet part out loud” about the president's advanced age and unpopularity.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;As reasonable as Mr Phillips's criticisms may be, his challenge looks doomed (“keep the faith” is one of his catchphrases).他可能会在1月23日举行的新罕布什尔州初选中出乎意料的得分，拜登先生正在抵制民主党内部的安排争吵。此后，事情会更加困难。一些州，例如佛罗里达州，实际上已经取消了他们的民主党初选，宣称只有一名合格的候选人。进行投票的困难促使候选人的儿子罗伯特·肯尼迪·少年（Robert Kennedy Junior）于1968年被暗杀，他放弃了试图在针对拜登先生的初选中站在第三方选举中，试图在大选中进行投票candidate.

;
;;
;

;Even if more plausible candidates saw any hope of defeating Mr Biden, they are too late to initiate a serious primary challenge.作为小学候选人提起的截止日期已经过去了20多个州，并在1月初还通过了几条织机。 In recent years the primary calendar has become much more compressed: most of the almost 4,000 ordinary delegates will be allocated by the end of March (see chart 2), giving an insurgent candidate very little time to gain any momentum.

;

;All of which suggests that Mr Biden will easily secure his party's nomination.当然，有可能他有可能被专家称为“健康事件”的东西被迫抛弃。但是，这样的结果对民主党人来说不一定是天意。就像约翰逊在1968年宣布的那样，“我不会寻求，也不会接受，我的政党提名是您的总统”，pandemonium可能会随之而来。该党可能必须重写初选的规则，以使更多候选人迟到投票，但即使如此，该竞选活动也可能是讨厌，残酷和短暂的。 Only a few candidates, with the resources to crank up an electoral machine at short notice, would be able to compete.

;

;Harris teeters

;

;Kamala Harris, the vice-president, would be the presumptive nominee, with the institutional support of the party behind her and perhaps even Mr Biden's endorsement.民主党人是分层的。 The last time they denied a vice-president seeking the presidential nomination was in 1952. The unfortunate man was Harry Truman's deputy, Alben Barkley, a septuagenarian whose abysmal eyesight required documents to be set in inch-tall font.

;

;But Ms Harris, who ran a disastrous campaign for the presidency in 2020 that ended before the first votes were cast, would almost certainly attract challengers.尤戈夫说，只有36％的美国人认为她有资格担任总统。只有23％的人认为她会击败特朗普先生（包括2020年投票支持拜登先生的人，只有3％的特朗普选民）。 Although it would be awkward in an identity-conscious party to attempt to step over the first black and the first female vice-president, some rivals would probably be willing to take the plunge.

;
;;
;

;Gavin Newsom, the governor of California, is plainly clamouring for the chance to be president, although he denies it, and has built a formidable political machine.伊利诺伊州州长JB Pritzker既有野心，也有价值数十亿美元的继承财富。但是，许多民主党人认为要接替特朗普先生（例如肯塔基州的安迪·贝塞尔（Andy Beshear）），宾夕法尼亚州的乔什·夏皮罗（Josh Shapiro）或密歇根州的格蕾琴·惠特默（Gretchen Whitmer）的温和省长，是否没有足够的钱可以突然竞争开放的主要原理。或足够的时间来建立可行的活动。拜登内阁先生的最大政治才能，例如交通部长皮特·巴特吉格（Pete Buttigieg），商务部长吉娜·雷蒙多（Gina Raimondo），如果他们想进入竞争者，他们可能不得不辞职。 A coronation of Ms Harris might simply be unavoidable.

;

;If Mr Biden were forced to abandon his bid for the White House after lots of primaries had concluded, the confusion would be all the more intense.大政党提名候选人的规则非常复杂，但本质上，他们要求大多数代表在全国代表大会上支持获胜者。对于民主党人而言，这将于8月在芝加哥举行，这是与1968年的创伤大会的同一城市，警察在外面残酷地分散了反战抗议者，而迷惑的代表则在内部辩论前进的方向。通常，大多数代表被“承诺”，这意味着他们有望反映其在本国的主要结果。 But if they are pledged to a candidate who is no longer in the race they are treated much as “superdelegates”, the 746 party grandees who get to vote as they please.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;If Mr Biden were to withdraw after winning a big share of delegates, candidates to replace him would be forced to woo the party's patricians rather than its plebeians.该大会将从目前的形式（四天的选美比赛）中恢复到其老式格式：四天在充满烟雾的房间里讨价还价。乔治敦大学（Georgetown University）的政治学家汉斯·诺埃尔（Hans Noel）认为，比目前的“体育锦标赛”制度比目前的“体育比赛”制度更有可能培养能够团结一个易碎的现代党的候选人。但是，大多数民主党特工认为，在这种动荡之后，该党将会出现更加分裂，而不是统一。美国选民也没有使用这种阴谋。 They have not witnessed such a contested convention since 1976, when Republican grandees plumped for Gerald Ford over Ronald Reagan.

;

;If Mr Biden fell ill and were unable to contest the election after securing the nomination in August, the Democratic National Committee, which consists of a few hundred party operatives, would decide who to place at the top of the ticket. 1972年，民主党副总统候选人托马斯·伊格尔顿（Thomas Eagleton）在1972年之前只需要一次这次会议，在启示录中，他患有抑郁症并接受了电子电动汽车治疗后不得不退出。同样，在这种情况下，王室很可能会通过哈里斯女士。拜登先生似乎忠于她作为他的跑步伴侣。 Yet her shakiness as a candidate is thought to be one of the reasons Mr Biden is reluctant to bow out.

;

;Mr Biden's swooning poll numbers leave the Democrats in a miserable predicament.显然不太可取的替代方案。当被问及拜登先生是否会更好时，该党首选的公共关系策略是假装这个想法是荒谬的。拜登的工作人员讲述了他经常忍受的惩罚日子的英勇故事，并坚持认为他是如此机敏，知情和精神敏捷，以至于记者问尴尬的问题“无法与总统进行十分钟的政策简报”。 What they really mean is that there is no Plan ;B;. ;■;

;;I;;t was not; an auspicious time to open a pub在伦敦市中心。 When Michael Belben and his business; ;partner took over the Eagle on Farringdon Road, Britain was in recession.他们并不觉得从汽车靴销售中购买了不匹配的陶器，卸下了水果机和飞镖板，并安装了开放式厨房和黑板菜单。 The pub was relaunched in January 1991.

;

;In the decades since, the struggles and success of the Eagle—reputedly Britain's first “gastropub”—have encapsulated those of London itself.起初它的地中海菜是新颖的。但是，随着城市的口味和人口的多样化，其精致但负担得起的grub的公式被广泛模仿。 2007 - 09年的金融崩溃使鹰并未解雇；它贯穿了Covid-19及其毁灭性的社会统治规则。贝尔本说，对于一个始终雇用欧洲移民的场所，英国退欧可能会证明“一个可怕的问题”。 But not yet.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;“It's amazing how resilient we are,” he concludes.伦敦也可以这样说。在1990年代初期，似乎在滑雪道上的城市恢复活力。自第二次世界大战以来缩小了五分之一之后，人口开始增长。进取的外国人涌入。经济蓬勃发展，受到金融管制，欧洲一体化和共产主义崩溃的推动。 By the time it hosted the Olympic games in 2012, London had a fair claim to be the capital of the world.

;

;Cue a perfect storm of woes that threatened to capsize cities in general and London in particular.金融危机已经震惊了它的商业心脏。 Then a cosmopolis that runs on immigration faced the shuttering of Brexit and the pandemic barred tourists from one of the planet's most visited places.

;
;;
;

;Yet like the Eagle, London is thriving—a hardiness that holds lessons for cities everywhere.它的全球化经济使英国从欧盟退出远胜于厄运者所预测的要好得多。对于所有关于移民的政治危险，它仍然是雄心勃勃的新移民的磁铁。与许多城市相比，吸收Covid-19的破坏比许多城市更好。从南到北到东伦敦，您发现其最大的挑战是其活力的结果，而不是衰落。 Begin in the south London neighbourhood of Peckham.

;

;A regal woman in ceremonial Yoruba attire rides a horse down Peckham's high street.年轻人在西非杂货店打篮球和购物者的奇迹（与经典的伦敦Insouciance一起观看，有些不打眼睑）。 Adeyemi Michael's short film, recently on show at the South London Gallery in Peckham, honoured the Nigerians who began thronging to this part of the capital in the 1970s, earning it the nickname “Little Lagos”.

;;

;Southern crossroads

;

;You can still eat knockout jollof rice at Lolak Afrique, a café just off Peckham's main drag.但是社区和伦敦的尼日利亚社区正在发生变化。随着鸡尾酒吧和寿司餐厅的搬迁，尼日利亚人已经散开，他们的人数落在了Southwark，包括Peckham在内的自治市镇，并在其他地方上升。伦敦从未像一些美国城市那样被种族隔离。 as analysis by Gemma Catney of Queen's University Belfast shows, it has become progressively less so over the past few decades, the black African population dispersing especially fast.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;As it spreads, London's Nigerian population is growing.在过去的几年中，脱欧后的移民政策承认了更多来自欧洲以外的学生和工人（主要是医疗保健）。 In the year to June 2023, 141,000 Nigerians moved to Britain, more than the total from the entire ;EU;, to which there is now net emigration.

;

;On December 4th the government announced plans to cut immigration.但是至少到目前为止，人们对英国退欧可能阻止移民流向伦敦的恐惧尚未实现。在英国脱欧的讽刺之一中，其他到来的人对欧洲人的短缺弥补了更多的补偿。结果，伦敦在大流行期间倾诉的人口倾诉为900万，预计到2040年将达到1000万。考虑到技能和学生的流入，伦敦国王学院的乔纳森·港口（Jonathan Portes）说，英国脱欧市对城市的乔纳森·港口（Jonathan Portes）表示，“至少在移民方面，有什么是积极的。” It remains “a roost for every bird”, as Benjamin Disraeli wrote in 1870.

;

;Nor does the latest influx into what was already a spectacularly diverse city seem to have stirred much tension.根据IPSOS的说法，一名民意测验员，伦敦人说移民对他们的家乡产生了积极影响的可能性是巴黎人的两倍以上。塞拉·布拉弗曼（Suella Braverman）被迫在保守党政府担任内政大臣，最近声称多元文化主义“失败了”。她正在走动相反的证据：一位来自毛里求斯和肯尼亚的父母在伦敦长大的佛教徒，她找到了一个犹太丈夫，并升至该国最高的办公室之一。 The London dream, you might call it.

;

;In another widely predicted way, Brexit has indeed bruised London: by damaging the City, an engine of growth already beleaguered by the financial crisis and the rise of other hubs. Yet as at the Eagle, the consequences have, so far, been manageable.

;

;Brexit's overall costs will be felt as much in things that don't happen—internships forgone, romances that never blossom—as in those that do.智囊团新金融公司的威廉·赖特（William Wright）说，它对这座城市的影响也是如此。他指出了美国投资银行在巴黎创造的数百个新工作，在不同的情况下，这可能会来到伦敦。 As for things that have happened: London's share of new listings, and of trade in European equities and derivatives, has dwindled.

;

;Still, relatively few existing jobs have been relocated from the City because of Brexit. The latest estimate by ;EY;, a consultancy, is around 7,000, far lower than the tens of thousands once anticipated. The City will no longer be the default financial centre ;for ;Europe, predicts Mr Wright; but because of its status in global financial markets, it is set to remain the dominant hub ;in; Europe. It is big enough to cope.

;;;

;Besides sheer size, the City and the rest of London enjoy two other advantages in Brexit's aftermath. The first is that they already did lots of business with the world beyond Europe, receiving copious foreign direct investment (;FDI;) from America especially. London has become even more reliant on American investment since Brexit, observes Riccardo Crescenzi of the London School of Economics (;lse;). Worryingly, when downsizing and divestment are included, in 2021 there was a net outflow of foreign capital from both London and Britain for the first time since 1984. Even so, says Professor Crescenzi, London is still the top city in Europe for new ;FDI; projects.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;The other plus is that the industries in which London specialises—not just finance but law, accounting, consulting, the media and higher education—have been less hampered by post-Brexit rules than other sectors.另一个智囊团分辨率基金会的艾米丽·弗莱（Emily Fry）指出，在2016年至2021年之间，伦敦的服务出口增长了47％。在英国其他地区，上升仅为4％。 Places that import parts and export goods have suffered more Brexit-related costs and bureaucracy.

;

;The momentum of the tech scene, in particular, is too strong to be “stopped in its tracks”, insists Brent Hoberman, a tech guru and investor.由于英国退欧“我们必须更加偏执”，但他认为，伦敦仍然是在欧洲创办科技公司的最佳场所。美国风险资本家仍然热衷。 The record supports his confidence: London has produced more tech unicorns than its three nearest European rivals—Berlin, Paris and Stockholm—combined.

;

;Unhobbled hub

;

;Its perennial virtues—the time zone, English language and rule of law—are reinforced by the proximity of top universities and an abundance of skills and capital.位于伦敦的金融科技公司Kuda的创始人Babs Ogundeyi表示，精明的当地天使投资者帮助吸引了更多的资本。库达（Kuda）在尼日利亚经营一家仅数字银行，并为英国的非洲人提供汇款服务。 For all Brexit's hassles, Mr Ogundeyi notes, it has led to closer ties to Africa.

;

;The upshot is another irony of Brexit;您可能还称其为业力或诗意正义。 London, the only region of England that in the referendum of 2016 voted to stay in the ;EU;, has fared better than regions that wanted to leave.出于重叠的原因，它从大流行中反弹得更快。 Head to north London to see why.

;

;Sally north

;

;On a chilly evening at Arsenal's football stadium, the club's new anthem rings around the ground: “North London for ever/Whatever the weather/These streets are our own.”这是一种感性但影响的曲调，尤其是在被禁止观众的几个月后。现在体育场被挤满了；车队的吉祥物Gunnersaurus是高射手的年轻球迷。 The faithful are loudly outraged by lunging tackles on their hero, the winger Bukayo Saka (he duly scores).

;

;Like the carousing at the Eagle, London's entertainment economy is buoyant again after the deathly doldrums of covid-19.它的七个英超足球俱乐部在全球范围内计划软实力。旅游业几乎恢复了大流行的水平，这是由于美国游客的增加而推动了。伦敦剧院协会说，观众开始了。 On some weekends the Tube is busier than in 2019.

;

;All told, London's nimble economy has recovered much more strongly than has the rest of the country's.像其他城市一样，它在后培养的世界中面临障碍。 But it is better equipped for them than many.

;

;Already under pressure from online shopping, some retail districts are struggling—notably Oxford Street, which this year looks somewhat bedraggled beneath its Christmas lights.随着睡眠不足的崛起，空置商店在伦敦市中心部分地区造成了破旧的空气。 By some accounts, however, the main threat to its pizzazz is Londoners' reluctance to return to the office full-time.

;

;One Triton Square, an office tower a mile from the Eagle, near Regent's Park, is an emblem of this trend.它具有现代化的办公大楼的所有风味附属物，包括攀岩墙和美术馆。但是建筑物是空的。灯光在黑暗中庭怪异地闪烁；自动扶梯被冷冻。 Earlier this year Meta, the parent company of Facebook, paid a whopping fee to cancel its lease on the tower before it even moved in.

;

;幽灵般的建筑不是唯一的。 Vacancy rates in commercial property in central London are high, in part because—as elsewhere, only more so—people are loth to kick the working-from-home (;WFH;) habit acquired during the pandemic.最近对城市中心的一项调查（也是一个智障人士）发现，平均而言，伦敦市中心的工人每周2.3天，比其他英国人少。在斯坦福大学尼克·布鲁姆（Nick Bloom）进行研究的32个国家中，英国工人比任何加拿大人都呆在家里。 Taken together, these findings imply Londoners are among the most absent workers anywhere.

;

;Face-to-face interactions are good for productivity, already stalling in London before the pandemic.办公室低落可能会及时阻止外国投资者。 Then again, in a ;WFH; future, London has enticements that other places lack.

;

;A three-days-a-week office will have to look different from the antediluvian sort: more flexible and alluring. Yet networking, transport and entertainment possibilities mean the case for keeping a central-London ;HQ; is stronger than for having a satellite office. Notably, the ;WFH; culture has not led armies of Londoners to retreat beyond striking distance of the workplace. Most inner Londoners who moved home between the summers of 2021 and 2022 circulated around the city,; ;rather than fleeing it.

;

;It has brushed off another crisis that some thought would nobble it: the war in Ukraine and ensuing sanctions on Russia's elite, who had brought joy to London's libel lawyers, estate agents,; PR; firms and football fans 。尽管他们的臭名昭著和夸张，但他们的慷慨始终不如中国和中东那样重要。无论如何，许多其他高级滚动者仍然将伦敦称为家，或其中一个。 （对于伦敦放纵寡头的ozymandian纪念碑，从哈罗德（Harrods）向西漫步并寻找一个废弃的管子站。2014年，政府以5300万英镑的价格出售了它，当时是8700万美元，当时是8700万美元，以达米特里·弗塔什（Dmitry Firtash on charges of alleged corruption, which he denies.)

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;London, after all, has absorbed all manner of shocks in its 2,000-year history. Its most precarious period, considers Tony Travers of the ;lse;, came after the Romans left in the fifth century ;AD;.黑人死亡在1340年代丧生。 1666年的大火散布着它。一个适合其港口下降的港口城市，它也是帝国资本，适应帝国的丧失。 It defied the Blitz of 1940-41—when, rather than sheltering in the Tube as urban myth has it, most Londoners simply slept at home.

;

;That phlegmatism is one of London's abiding traits.现在，它最大的担忧可能不是外部威胁，而是成功的影响。莫斯科，巴黎，首尔，东京：其他城市在其国家的政治和经济中占主导地位。即便如此，伦敦还是为政府，金融，媒体和艺术的掌握而脱颖而出（在Eagle发生冲突的世界，赚钱者和媒体类型的水坑以及美术馆的家中）。 Equally glaring are the differences in the demography and outlook of Londoners and their compatriots.

;

;At the last count, disposable household income per person was 43% higher in London than in the country as a whole.伦敦人更年轻，左翼和更多样化：少数民族占居民的46％，超过英格兰和威尔士的比例两倍。五分之二的伦敦人出生在国外。 Contrary to its reputation in the shires as a latter-day Gomorrah, on average London is slightly more socially conservative and less boozy than other regions.

;

;For that, thank its immigrants, many of whom are devout.他们还帮助提高了伦敦学校的标准，本世纪已从任何英语地区的表现最差。 For a close-up look at that phenomenon, go west.

;

;Known as “Little India”, the western suburb of Southall is studded with Punjabi and Afghan restaurants, mosques and Sikh temples.当地菲瑟斯通高中校长内森·沃尔特斯（Nathan Walters）说，其中85％的学生在家使用另一种语言。几乎三分之一接受免费的学校餐点（贫困的标准措施）。无论他们自己是否会说英语，父母都对教育“始终如一”；结果远远超过全国平均水平。沃尔特斯先生说，与机会接近是一种动力。 Pupils “can almost see it from their bedroom windows”.

;

;London's dominance, and voracity for people and capital, have been concerns for centuries. 400多年前，詹姆斯一世国王抓住了：“很快，伦敦将成为英国。”在19世纪，它被称为“伟大的天文”（囊肿）。如今，民意调查发现其他英国人认为它是拥挤而昂贵的，它的居民是傲慢而孤立的。许多人认为政策制定者和财政部受到青睐，尽管它的贡献远远超过了回归。 London's net fiscal contribution per head is over £4,000.

;;
;;
;

;That sort of resentment has fed populism across the West.在英国，它为英国脱欧公投着色。 Yet since then, the divide—in wealth, diversity and opportunity—has grown (see chart 1).

;

;In its bid to narrow the gaps, the current government, like its predecessors, has recycled failed ideas.如最近的议会报告所指出的那样，例如，每十到15年就可以可靠地发起一项将民用服务工作转移到该地区的计划。这种努力通常涉及限制伦敦的增长，希望将其转移到其他地方。 A good example was a misguided rule of 1964 (since discarded) that in effect banned new office developments in central London.

;

;Too often, policies have corseted the capital without boosting other places—and have wound up punishing everyone.事实证明，伦敦上诉的另一个巨大成本也很难解决。 This distress cry comes from inside the house.

;

;“Affordable housing isn't always as nice as this,” a resident of McGrath Road says with droll London understatement.对她来说，家是纽汉姆东伦敦区斯特拉特福德（Stratford）的一家迷人开发项目中的26栋房屋之一。在不称职的20世纪庄园中，这些单位，其中一些是公共住房，形成了看起来像摩尔人的城堡，带有炮塔和cr骨，但也欢迎拱门，阳台和绿树成荫的中央庭院。 Walk up to the railway tracks and you spy the glinting towers that were part of the regeneration spurred by the Olympics.

;
;;
;

;Peter Barber, the architect of McGrath Road, says a lot can be learned from the compact cities of north Africa and the Middle East.他回忆说，纽汉姆理事会最初预计设计了一块公寓。取而代之的是，他模仿了格鲁吉亚露台，这些露台是有效的伦敦住房的acme，具有独特的转折。

;

;Clogged roads, air pollution, long and pricey commutes, a discredited police force—inevitably London suffers from many big-city ailments.与他们的同胞相比，伦敦人报告的邻里归属感低下。在如此狂热的情况下，生活会感到孤独和雾化。 (“It is strange with how little notice”, wrote Charles Dickens, “a man may live and die in London.”); ;But the most acute problem, and most enduring, is the scarcity and cost of housing—and it is sharpest, and most intransigent, in the East End.

;

;Orient compress

;

;In late Victorian times the East End was known as “the empire of hunger” and “the city of dreadful night”.如今，纽汉姆人满为患的人满为数，这是该市的两倍，其本身是全国平均水平的两倍以上。 The basic causes of the shortage are a failure over decades to provide sufficient new homes and to use space as imaginatively as does Mr Barber.

;

;The result has been at once inevitable and stunning.美国政治战略家詹姆斯·卡维尔（James Carville）曾经开玩笑说他想被转世为债券市场，因为那时他可以恐吓所有人。另一个不错的选择是作为伦敦房屋价格回来：也许只有该市的大狐狸才能与其坚不可摧的性能相匹配。 True, a finance-driven boom that lasted two decades has recently flattened, but at a dizzying plateau.

;
;
;

;In 2020 the average house in the capital sold for over 13 times average earnings, almost double the ratio two decades earlier (see chart 2）。鹰附近的两居室公寓将使您回落约100万英镑。自1981年以来，居住在公共住房中的伦敦人的份额已从三分之一以上降至第五。私营部门的租金飙升：2022年，租金中位数是中位收入的35％。 As Jack Brown of King's College London says, the city “has never been quite this big or quite this expensive”.

;

;All this means the perception of Londoners as wealthy is incomplete.这是一个有很多穷人的富裕城市。住房成本和贫困率的因素高于英格兰其他地区。伦敦的许多家庭居住在临时住宿中的八倍。最富裕的十分位数的收入近十倍。 Because of London's unusually integrated economic geography, deprived and well-heeled families rub shoulders more than in Paris or New York, pound shops abutting artisan bakeries on the high street.

;
;
;
;
;
;
;

;特拉弗斯教授指出，人们对伦敦的拥挤方式抱怨，回想起这家餐厅如此拥挤的旧笑话，没人愿意去那里。尽管如此，大流行仍可能为这个古老的问题打开解决方案。在有办公室和房屋不足的地方，在可能的情况下，将商业建筑重新为住宅是有意义的。 More than ever, in an age of hybrid work it is time to build on some of the protected land of the “green belt”, starting with existing commuter corridors.

;

;Something like this happened after crises of yore.克里斯托弗·雷恩（Christopher Wren）在大火的灰烬中重新构想了这座城市。理想主义的城市规划师在闪电战的废墟中再次这样做。过去几年和过去两千年的证据是，伦敦（世界上最伟大的城市之一，也许是最有弹性的城市之一）将找到一种应对和壮成长的方法。 ;■;
